pli-tv-kd17:0.3.eng: The chapter on schism in the Sangha

pli-tv-kd17:0.5.eng: 1. The account of the going forth of the six Sakyans

pli-tv-kd17:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā anupiyāyaṃ viharati, anupiyaṃ nāma mallānaṃ nigamo.
pli-tv-kd17:1.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at the Mallian town of Anupiyā.

pli-tv-kd17:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena abhiññātā abhiññātā sakyakumārā bhagavantaṃ pabbajitaṃ anupabbajanti.
pli-tv-kd17:1.1.2.eng: At that time a number of well-known young Sakyans had followed the Buddha in going forth.

pli-tv-kd17:1.1.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena mahānāmo ca sakko anuruddho ca sakko dvebhātikā honti.
pli-tv-kd17:1.1.3.eng: Then there were the brothers Mahānāma and Anuruddha.

pli-tv-kd17:1.1.4.eng: Anuruddha had been brought up in great comfort.

pli-tv-kd17:1.1.5.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “stilt house” for pāsāda, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd17:1.1.6.pli: eko hemantiko, eko gimhiko, eko vassiko.
pli-tv-kd17:1.1.6.eng: one for the winter, one for the summer, and one for the rainy season.

pli-tv-kd17:1.1.7.pli: So vassike pāsāde cattāro māse nippurisehi tūriyehi paricārayamāno na heṭṭhāpāsādaṃ orohati.
pli-tv-kd17:1.1.7.eng: He spent the four months of the rainy season in the rainy-season house, attended on only by female musicians, never descending from that house.

pli-tv-kd17:1.1.9.pli: “etarahi kho abhiññātā abhiññātā sakyakumārā bhagavantaṃ pabbajitaṃ anupabbajanti.
pli-tv-kd17:1.1.9.eng: “A number of well-known young Sakyans have just followed the Buddha in going forth,

pli-tv-kd17:1.1.10.pli: Amhākañca pana kulā natthi koci agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito.

pli-tv-kd17:1.1.11.eng: Why doesn’t Anuruddha or I go forth?”

pli-tv-kd17:1.1.12.pli: Atha kho mahānāmo sakko yena anuruddho sakko tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā anuruddhaṃ sakkaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:1.1.12.eng: He then went to Anuruddha and told him what he had thought.

pli-tv-kd17:1.1.13.pli: “etarahi, tāta anuruddha, abhiññātā abhiññātā sakyakumārā bhagavantaṃ pabbajitaṃ anupabbajanti.

pli-tv-kd17:1.1.14.pli: Amhākañca pana kulā natthi koci agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito.

pli-tv-kd17:1.1.15.pli: Tena hi tvaṃ vā pabbaja, ahaṃ vā pabbajissāmī”ti.

pli-tv-kd17:1.1.16.pli: “Ahaṃ kho sukhumālo, nāhaṃ sakkomi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajituṃ.
pli-tv-kd17:1.1.16.eng: Anuruddha replied, “I’ve been brought up in great comfort. I’m not able to go forth.

pli-tv-kd17:1.2.1.pli: “Ehi kho te, tāta anuruddha, gharāvāsatthaṃ anusāsissāmi.
pli-tv-kd17:1.2.1.eng: “Come, then, let me teach you how to run the family business.

pli-tv-kd17:1.2.2.eng: First you must plow the fields,

pli-tv-kd17:1.2.7.eng: Next you must cut the harvest,

pli-tv-kd17:1.2.9.comm: Sp-ṭ 4.330: Ujuṁ kārāpetabbanti puñjaṁ kārāpetabbaṁ, “To be made straight means to be made into heaps.” It seems from this that the original meaning may have been ujuṁ kārāpetabbaṁ rather than puñjaṁ kārāpetabbaṁ. I interpret “to make straight” as organizing the harvest into sheaves.

pli-tv-kd17:1.2.14.eng: before you bring it into storage.

pli-tv-kd17:1.2.15.pli: Atiharāpetvā āyatimpi vassaṃ evameva kātabbaṃ, āyatimpi vassaṃ evameva kātabban”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:1.2.15.eng: And next year you must do the same, and the next.”

pli-tv-kd17:1.2.17.eng: I can’t see any end to it.

pli-tv-kd17:1.2.20.pli: Kadā mayaṃ appossukkā pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappitā samaṅgībhūtā paricāressāmā”ti?
pli-tv-kd17:1.2.20.eng: When can you enjoy yourself with worldly pleasures, free from bother?”

pli-tv-kd17:1.2.22.eng: and you won’t see any end to it.

pli-tv-kd17:1.2.23.pli: Akhīṇeva kamme pitaro ca pitāmahā ca kālaṅkatā”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:1.2.23.eng: While the work was still unfinished, our fathers and grandfathers have all died.”

pli-tv-kd17:1.2.24.eng: “Well then, you go ahead and run the family business.
pli-tv-kd17:1.2.24.comm: “Go ahead” renders upajānāhi. According to Sp 4.330, upajānāhi is just another word for jānāhi. Sp-ṭ 4.330 adds: Jānāhīti cettha paṭipajjāti attho veditabbo, “Jānāhi: here the meaning ‘practice’ should be understood.”

pli-tv-kd17:1.2.26.pli: Atha kho anuruddho sakko yena mātā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā mātaraṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:1.2.26.eng: Anuruddha then went to his mother and said,

pli-tv-kd17:1.2.27.eng: “Mom, I wish to go forth into homelessness.

pli-tv-kd17:1.2.29.pli: Evaṃ vutte, anuruddhassa sakkassa mātā anuruddhaṃ sakkaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd17:1.2.30.pli: “tumhe kho me, tāta anuruddha, dve puttā piyā manāpā appaṭikūlā.
pli-tv-kd17:1.2.30.eng: “Both of you, Anuruddha, my two sons, are dear and beloved to me.

pli-tv-kd17:1.2.31.eng: Even if you died, I would lose you against my wishes.

pli-tv-kd17:1.2.32.pli: Kiṃ panāhaṃ tumhe jīvante anujānissāmi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjāyā”ti?
pli-tv-kd17:1.2.32.eng: So how can I allow you to go forth into homelessness while you’re still living?”

pli-tv-kd17:1.2.33.eng: A second time Anuruddha asked the same question and got the same reply.

pli-tv-kd17:1.2.34.pli: tatiyampi kho anuruddho sakko mātaraṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:1.2.34.eng: He then asked a third time.

pli-tv-kd17:1.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhaddiyo sakyarājā sakyānaṃ rajjaṃ kāreti.
pli-tv-kd17:1.3.1.eng: At that time the Sakyans were ruled by King Bhaddiya,

pli-tv-kd17:1.3.2.pli: So ca anuruddhassa sakkassa sahāyo hoti.

pli-tv-kd17:1.3.4.pli: “ayaṃ kho bhaddiyo sakyarājā sakyānaṃ rajjaṃ kāreti;

pli-tv-kd17:1.3.6.pli: so na ussahati agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajitun”ti—
pli-tv-kd17:1.3.6.eng: and thought, “Bhaddiya won’t be able to go forth into homelessness.”

pli-tv-kd17:1.3.8.pli: “sace, tāta anuruddha, bhaddiyo sakyarājā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajati, evaṃ tvampi pabbajāhī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:1.3.8.eng: “If King Bhaddiya goes forth, you may go forth too.”

pli-tv-kd17:1.3.9.pli: Atha kho anuruddho sakko yena bhaddiyo sakyarājā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhaddiyaṃ sakyarājānaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:1.3.9.eng: Anuruddha then went to King Bhaddiya and said,

pli-tv-kd17:1.3.11.pli: “Sace te, samma, pabbajjā mama paṭibaddhā vā appaṭibaddhā vā sā hotu, ahaṃ tayā;
pli-tv-kd17:1.3.11.eng: “Don’t worry about whether your going forth depends on mine or not. I’m with you.

pli-tv-kd17:1.3.12.eng: Just go forth when you like.”

pli-tv-kd17:1.3.15.pli: Yaṃ te sakkā aññaṃ mayā kātuṃ, kyāhaṃ karissāmi.
pli-tv-kd17:1.3.15.eng: I’m not able to do what you do. There’s nothing I can do about it.

pli-tv-kd17:1.3.18.pli: ‘sace, tāta anuruddha, bhaddiyo sakyarājā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajati, evaṃ tvampi pabbajāhī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:1.3.18.eng: that I may go forth only if you go forth.

pli-tv-kd17:1.3.19.pli: “Bhāsitā kho pana te, samma, esā vācā.

pli-tv-kd17:1.3.20.pli: Sace te, samma, pabbajjā mama paṭibaddhā vā, appaṭibaddhā vā sā hotu, ahaṃ tayā;
pli-tv-kd17:1.3.20.eng: ‘Don’t worry about whether your going forth depends on mine or not. I’m with you.

pli-tv-kd17:1.3.21.eng: Just go forth when you like.’

pli-tv-kd17:1.3.22.eng: So come, let’s go forth together.”

pli-tv-kd17:1.3.23.pli: Tena kho pana samayena manussā saccavādino honti, saccapaṭiññā.
pli-tv-kd17:1.3.23.eng: At that time people spoke the truth,

pli-tv-kd17:1.3.24.pli: Atha kho bhaddiyo sakyarājā anuruddhaṃ sakkaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:1.3.24.eng: and so Bhaddiya said to Anuruddha,

pli-tv-kd17:1.3.26.pli: Sattannaṃ vassānaṃ accayena ubho agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajissāmā”ti.

pli-tv-kd17:1.3.28.eng: I’m not able to wait for seven years.”

pli-tv-kd17:1.3.35.pli: Ekassa vassassa accayena ubho agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajissāmā”ti.

pli-tv-kd17:1.3.37.eng: I’m not able to wait for one year.”

pli-tv-kd17:1.3.39.pli: Sattannaṃ māsānaṃ accayena ubhopi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajissāmā”ti.

pli-tv-kd17:1.3.41.eng: I’m not able to wait for seven months.”

pli-tv-kd17:1.3.49.pli: Aḍḍhamāsassa accayena ubhopi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajissāmā”ti.

pli-tv-kd17:1.3.51.eng: I’m not able to wait for half a month.”

pli-tv-kd17:1.3.52.pli: “Āgamehi, samma, sattāhaṃ yāvāhaṃ putte ca bhātaro ca rajjaṃ niyyādemī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:1.3.52.eng: “Then wait seven days, while I hand over the rulership to my sons and brothers.”

pli-tv-kd17:1.4.1.pli: Atha kho bhaddiyo ca sakyarājā anuruddho ca ānando ca bhagu ca kimilo ca devadatto ca, upālikappakena sattamā, yathā pure caturaṅginiyā senāya uyyānabhūmiṃ niyyanti, evameva caturaṅginiyā senāya niyyiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd17:1.4.1.eng: Soon afterwards King Bhaddiya, Anuruddha, Ānanda, Bhagu, Kimila, and Devadatta, with the barber Upāli as the seventh, went out to the park with the fourfold army, just as they had in the past.

pli-tv-kd17:1.4.2.pli: Te dūraṃ gantvā senaṃ nivattāpetvā paravisayaṃ okkamitvā ābharaṇaṃ omuñcitvā uttarāsaṅgena bhaṇḍikaṃ bandhitvā upāliṃ kappakaṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd17:1.4.2.eng: After going a good distance, they turned back the army. They then entered a foreign territory, removed their ornaments, bound them into a bundle with an upper robe, and said to Upāli,

pli-tv-kd17:1.4.4.eng: This is enough for you to live on.”

pli-tv-kd17:1.4.5.pli: Atha kho upālissa kappakassa nivattantassa etadahosi—
pli-tv-kd17:1.4.5.eng: As Upāli was returning, he thought,

pli-tv-kd17:1.4.7.eng: They may think that I’m responsible for the departure of these young men and have me executed.

pli-tv-kd17:1.4.8.pli: Ime hi nāma sakyakumārā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajissanti.
pli-tv-kd17:1.4.8.eng: Now, if these young Sakyans are going forth into homelessness,

pli-tv-kd17:1.4.10.pli: Bhaṇḍikaṃ muñcitvā taṃ bhaṇḍaṃ rukkhe ālaggetvā “yo passati, dinnaṃyeva haratū”ti vatvā yena te sakyakumārā tenupasaṅkami.
pli-tv-kd17:1.4.10.eng: Undoing the bundle, he hung the goods from a tree, saying, “This is given to whoever sees it. They may take it away.” And he returned to the young Sakyans.

pli-tv-kd17:1.4.11.pli: Addasāsuṃ kho te sakyakumārā upāliṃ kappakaṃ dūratova āgacchantaṃ.

pli-tv-kd17:1.4.14.eng: And he told what he had done.

pli-tv-kd17:1.4.17.pli: Ime hi nāma sakyakumārā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajissanti.

pli-tv-kd17:1.4.19.pli: So kho ahaṃ, ayyaputtā, bhaṇḍikaṃ muñcitvā taṃ bhaṇḍaṃ rukkhe ālaggetvā ‘yo passati, dinnaññeva haratū’ti vatvā tatomhi paṭinivatto”ti.

pli-tv-kd17:1.4.20.pli: “Suṭṭhu, bhaṇe upāli, akāsi yampi na nivatto.

pli-tv-kd17:1.4.22.eng: They might well have held you responsible for our departure and have had you executed.”

pli-tv-kd17:1.4.23.pli: Atha kho sakyakumārā upāliṃ kappakaṃ ādāya yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd17:1.4.23.eng: The young Sakyans then took Upāli with them and went to the Buddha, where they bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd17:1.4.24.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnā kho te sakyakumārā bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-kd17:1.4.26.pli: Ayaṃ, bhante, upāli kappako amhākaṃ dīgharattaṃ paricārako.
pli-tv-kd17:1.4.26.eng: This barber Upāli has been serving us for a long time.

pli-tv-kd17:1.4.27.eng: Please let him go forth first.

pli-tv-kd17:1.4.28.eng: We’ll then bow down to him, rise up for him, raise our joined palms to him, and do acts of respect toward him.

pli-tv-kd17:1.4.29.eng: In this way our Sakyan pride will be humbled.”

pli-tv-kd17:1.4.30.pli: Atha kho bhagavā upāliṃ kappakaṃ paṭhamaṃ pabbājesi, pacchā te sakyakumāre.
pli-tv-kd17:1.4.30.eng: And the Buddha had Upāli go forth first, and afterwards the young Sakyans.

pli-tv-kd17:1.4.31.pli: Atha kho āyasmā bhaddiyo teneva antaravassena tisso vijjā sacchākāsi.
pli-tv-kd17:1.4.31.eng: During that very rainy season Venerable Bhaddiya realized the three insights,

pli-tv-kd17:1.4.34.eng: whereas Devadatta obtained supernormal powers, but no stage of awakening.

pli-tv-kd17:1.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā bhaddiyo araññagatopi rukkhamūlagatopi suññāgāragatopi abhikkhaṇaṃ udānaṃ udānesi—
pli-tv-kd17:1.5.1.eng: Then, when Bhaddiya was in the wilderness, at the foot of a tree, or in an empty dwelling, he frequently uttered this heartfelt exclamation:

pli-tv-kd17:1.5.3.pli: Atha kho sambahulā bhikkhū yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd17:1.5.3.eng: A number of monks went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd17:1.5.4.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnā kho te bhikkhū bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd17:1.5.4.eng: and told him what was happening,

pli-tv-kd17:1.5.5.pli: “āyasmā, bhante, bhaddiyo araññagatopi rukkhamūlagatopi suññāgāragatopi abhikkhaṇaṃ udānaṃ udānesi—

pli-tv-kd17:1.5.7.pli: Nissaṃsayaṃ kho, bhante, āyasmā bhaddiyo anabhiratova brahmacariyaṃ carati.
pli-tv-kd17:1.5.7.eng: adding, “No doubt Bhaddiya is dissatisfied with the spiritual life.

pli-tv-kd17:1.5.8.pli: Taṃyeva vā purimaṃ rajjasukhaṃ samanussaranto araññagatopi rukkhamūlagatopi suññāgāragatopi abhikkhaṇaṃ udānaṃ udānesi—
pli-tv-kd17:1.5.8.eng: He’s saying this because he’s recalling his former happiness as a king.”

pli-tv-kd17:1.5.10.pli: Atha kho bhagavā aññataraṃ bhikkhuṃ āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd17:1.5.10.eng: The Buddha addressed a certain monk:

pli-tv-kd17:1.5.11.pli: “ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, mama vacanena bhaddiyaṃ bhikkhuṃ āmantehi—
pli-tv-kd17:1.5.11.eng: “Go, monk, and in my name say to Bhaddiya,

pli-tv-kd17:1.5.13.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho so bhikkhu bhagavato paṭissutvā yenāyasmā bhaddiyo tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ bhaddiyaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:1.5.13.eng: Saying, “Yes, sir,” he did just that.

pli-tv-kd17:1.6.1.pli: “Evamāvuso”ti kho āyasmā bhaddiyo tassa bhikkhuno paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd17:1.6.1.eng: Bhaddiya consented. He then went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-kd17:1.6.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho āyasmantaṃ bhaddiyaṃ bhagavā etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd17:1.6.3.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, bhaddiya, araññagatopi rukkhamūlagatopi suññāgāragatopi abhikkhaṇaṃ udānaṃ udānesi—
pli-tv-kd17:1.6.3.eng: “Is it true, Bhaddiya, that when you’re in the wilderness, at the foot of a tree, or in an empty dwelling, you frequently utter this heartfelt exclamation:

pli-tv-kd17:1.6.6.pli: “Kiṃ pana tvaṃ, bhaddiya, atthavasaṃ sampassamāno araññagatopi rukkhamūlagatopi suññāgāragatopi abhikkhaṇaṃ udānaṃ udānesi—

pli-tv-kd17:1.6.8.pli: “Pubbe me, bhante, rañño satopi antopi antepure rakkhā susaṃvihitā hoti, bahipi antepure rakkhā susaṃvihitā hoti, antopi nagare rakkhā susaṃvihitā hoti, bahipi nagare rakkhā susaṃvihitā hoti, antopi janapade rakkhā susaṃvihitā hoti, bahipi janapade rakkhā susaṃvihitā hoti.
pli-tv-kd17:1.6.8.eng: “In the past, sir, when I was a king, I was well protected within and outside the royal compound, within and outside of town, and within and outside the country.

pli-tv-kd17:1.6.9.pli: So kho ahaṃ, bhante, evaṃ rakkhitopi gopitopi santo bhīto ubbiggo ussaṅkī utrasto viharāmi.
pli-tv-kd17:1.6.9.eng: But although I was protected and guarded in this way, I was fearful, agitated, and distrustful.

pli-tv-kd17:1.6.10.pli: Etarahi kho pana ahaṃ eko, bhante, araññagatopi rukkhamūlagatopi suññāgāragatopi abhīto anubbiggo anussaṅkī anutrasto appossukko pannalomo paradattavutto migabhūtena cetasā viharāmīti.
pli-tv-kd17:1.6.10.eng: But now, sir, when I’m in the wilderness, at the foot of a tree, or in an empty dwelling, I’m free from fear, agitation, and distrust. I’m free from bother, relaxed, living on what’s given by others, with a mind as free as a wild animal.

pli-tv-kd17:1.6.11.pli: Imaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, atthavasaṃ sampassamāno araññagatopi rukkhamūlagatopi suññāgāragatopi abhikkhaṇaṃ udānaṃ udānemi—

pli-tv-kd17:1.6.13.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etamatthaṃ viditvā tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imaṃ udānaṃ udānesi—
pli-tv-kd17:1.6.13.eng: Seeing the significance of this, on that occasion the Buddha uttered a heartfelt exclamation:

pli-tv-kd17:1.6.15.eng: Gone beyond any kind of existence,

pli-tv-kd17:1.6.16.eng: Happy, free from fear and sorrow—

pli-tv-kd17:1.6.17.eng: Even the gods are unable to see them.”
pli-tv-kd17:1.6.17.comm: Sp 4.332: Nānubhavantīti na sampāpuṇanti; tassa dassanaṁ devānampi dullabhanti adhippāyo, “Nānubhavanti: they do not attain; the meaning is that even for the gods seeing him is difficult.”

pli-tv-kd17:2.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā anupiyāyaṃ yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena kosambī tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd17:2.1.1.eng: When the Buddha had stayed at Anupiyā for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Kosambī.

pli-tv-kd17:2.1.2.pli: Anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena kosambī tadavasari.

pli-tv-kd17:2.1.3.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā kosambiyaṃ viharati ghositārāme.

pli-tv-kd17:2.1.4.pli: Atha kho devadattassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—
pli-tv-kd17:2.1.4.eng: Then, while reflecting in private, Devadatta thought,

pli-tv-kd17:2.1.5.pli: “kaṃ nu kho ahaṃ pasādeyyaṃ, yasmiṃ me pasanne bahulābhasakkāro uppajjeyyā”ti?
pli-tv-kd17:2.1.5.eng: “Who might I inspire to have confidence in me, so that I’d get much material support and honor?”

pli-tv-kd17:2.1.7.pli: “ayaṃ kho ajātasattu kumāro taruṇo ceva āyatiṃ bhaddo ca.
pli-tv-kd17:2.1.7.eng: “Prince Ajātasattu is young and has a bright future.

pli-tv-kd17:2.1.8.eng: Why don’t I inspire him to have confidence in me?

pli-tv-kd17:2.1.9.eng: Then I’ll get much material support and honor.”

pli-tv-kd17:2.1.10.pli: Atha kho devadatto senāsanaṃ saṃsāmetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena rājagahaṃ tena pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd17:2.1.10.eng: He put his dwelling in order, took his bowl and robes, and left for Rājagaha,

pli-tv-kd17:2.1.12.pli: Atha kho devadatto sakavaṇṇaṃ paṭisaṃharitvā kumārakavaṇṇaṃ abhinimminitvā ahimekhalikāya ajātasattussa kumārassa ucchaṅge pāturahosi.
pli-tv-kd17:2.1.12.eng: He then transformed himself into a boy wearing a snake as a belt and appeared on Prince Ajātasattu’s lap.

pli-tv-kd17:2.1.13.pli: Atha kho ajātasattu kumāro bhīto ahosi, ubbiggo ussaṅkī utrasto.
pli-tv-kd17:2.1.13.eng: When Ajātasattu became fearful and agitated,

pli-tv-kd17:2.1.14.pli: Atha kho devadatto ajātasattuṃ kumāraṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd17:2.1.19.pli: “Sace kho tvaṃ, bhante, ayyo devadatto, iṅgha sakeneva vaṇṇena pātubhavassū”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:2.1.19.eng: “If you’re Venerable Devadatta, please appear in your own form.”

pli-tv-kd17:2.1.20.pli: Atha kho devadatto kumārakavaṇṇaṃ paṭisaṃharitvā saṅghāṭipattacīvaradharo ajātasattussa kumārassa purato aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-kd17:2.1.20.eng: Devadatta abandoned the form of a boy and stood in front of Ajātasattu, wearing his robes and carrying his bowl.
pli-tv-kd17:2.1.20.comm: “Wearing his robes and carrying his bowl” renders saṅghāṭipattacīvaradharo. In the vinaya, saṅghāṭi frequently refers to whatever robe is worn on the upper body without distinguishing whether it is the single layered one or the double layered one. In other instances where saṅghāṭi and cīvara are spoken of together, as they are here, the cīvara seems to refer to the third robe, which is often spare, whereas the saṅghāṭi refers to the upper robe. See for instance Bu Ss 8:1.7.21 where we find the following: Atha kho mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā ārāmaṁ gantvā pattacīvaraṁ paṭisāmetvā bahārāmakoṭṭhake saṅghāṭipallatthikāya nisīdiṁsu, “When they had eaten their meal and returned from alms round, they put their bowls and robes away, and squatted on their heels outside the monastery gatehouse, using their upper robes as back-and-knee straps.” See also note on saṅghāṭi in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd17:2.1.21.pli: Atha kho ajātasattu kumāro devadattassa iminā iddhipāṭihāriyena abhippasanno pañcahi rathasatehi sāyaṃ pātaṃ upaṭṭhānaṃ gacchati, pañca ca thālipākasatāni bhattābhihāro abhiharīyati.
pli-tv-kd17:2.1.21.eng: By means of this wonder Devadatta was able to inspire Ajātasattu to have confidence in him. Ajātasattu then attended on him morning and evening, with five hundred carriages and a meal offering of five hundred dishes of food.

pli-tv-kd17:2.1.22.pli: Atha kho devadattassa lābhasakkārasilokena abhibhūtassa pariyādinnacittassa evarūpaṃ icchāgataṃ uppajji—
pli-tv-kd17:2.1.22.eng: Overcome by material support, honor, and praise,

pli-tv-kd17:2.1.23.eng: Devadatta started desiring to lead the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-kd17:2.1.24.pli: Saha cittuppādāva devadatto tassā iddhiyā parihāyi.
pli-tv-kd17:2.1.24.eng: But with the appearance of that thought, his supernormal powers disappeared.

pli-tv-kd17:2.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena kakudho nāma koḷiyaputto, āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa upaṭṭhāko, adhunā kālaṅkato aññataraṃ manomayaṃ kāyaṃ upapanno.
pli-tv-kd17:2.2.1.eng: At that time Kakudha the Koḷiyan, the attendant to Venerable Mahāmoggallāna, had recently died and been reborn in a mind-made body.
pli-tv-kd17:2.2.1.comm: This is a parallel to AN 5.100:0.1.

pli-tv-kd17:2.2.3.pli: seyyathāpi nāma dve vā tīṇi vā māgadhakāni gāmakkhettāni.
pli-tv-kd17:2.2.3.eng: two or three times the size of the fields of a Magadhan village.

pli-tv-kd17:2.2.4.pli: So tena attabhāvappaṭilābhena neva attānaṃ na paraṃ byābādheti.
pli-tv-kd17:2.2.4.eng: Yet he harmed neither himself nor others with that body.

pli-tv-kd17:2.2.5.pli: Atha kho kakudho devaputto yenāyasmā mahāmoggallāno tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ mahāmoggallānaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-kd17:2.2.5.eng: Soon afterwards the god Kakudha approached Mahāmoggallāna, bowed down,

pli-tv-kd17:2.2.6.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhito kho kakudho devaputto āyasmantaṃ mahāmoggallānaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd17:2.2.7.pli: “devadattassa, bhante, lābhasakkārasilokena abhibhūtassa pariyādinnacittassa evarūpaṃ icchāgataṃ uppajji—

pli-tv-kd17:2.2.9.pli: Saha cittuppādāva, bhante, devadatto tassā iddhiyā parihīno”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:2.2.9.eng: and the disappearance of his supernormal powers.

pli-tv-kd17:2.2.11.pli: Idaṃ vatvā āyasmantaṃ mahāmoggallānaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā tattheva antaradhāyi.
pli-tv-kd17:2.2.11.eng: He then bowed down, circumambulated Mahāmoggallāna with his right side toward him, and disappeared right there.

pli-tv-kd17:2.2.12.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd17:2.2.12.eng: Mahāmoggallāna then went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd17:2.2.13.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:2.2.13.eng: and told him all that had happened.

pli-tv-kd17:2.2.14.pli: “kakudho nāma, bhante, koḷiyaputto mama upaṭṭhāko adhunā kālaṅkato aññataraṃ manomayaṃ kāyaṃ upapanno.

pli-tv-kd17:2.2.16.pli: seyyathāpi nāma dve vā tīṇi vā māgadhakāni gāmakkhettāni.

pli-tv-kd17:2.2.17.pli: So tena attabhāvappaṭilābhena neva attānaṃ na paraṃ byābādheti.

pli-tv-kd17:2.2.18.pli: Atha kho, bhante, kakudho devaputto yenāhaṃ tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā maṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi.

pli-tv-kd17:2.2.19.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhito kho, bhante, kakudho devaputto maṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd17:2.2.20.pli: ‘devadattassa, bhante, lābhasakkārasilokena abhibhūtassa pariyādinnacittassa evarūpaṃ icchāgataṃ uppajji—

pli-tv-kd17:2.2.22.pli: Saha cittuppādāva, bhante, devadatto tassā iddhiyā parihīno’ti.

pli-tv-kd17:2.2.24.pli: Idaṃ vatvā maṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā tattheva antaradhāyī”ti.

pli-tv-kd17:2.2.25.pli: “Kiṃ pana te, moggallāna, kakudho devaputto cetasā ceto paricca vidito?
pli-tv-kd17:2.2.25.eng: The Buddha said, “But, Moggallāna, have you read Kakudha’s mind

pli-tv-kd17:2.2.26.pli: Yaṃ kiñci kakudho devaputto bhāsati sabbaṃ taṃ tatheva hoti, no aññathā”ti?
pli-tv-kd17:2.2.26.eng: so that you know that all he says is just so and not otherwise?”

pli-tv-kd17:2.2.27.pli: “Cetasā ceto paricca vidito ca me, bhante, kakudho devaputto.

pli-tv-kd17:2.2.28.pli: Yaṃ kiñci kakudho devaputto bhāsati sabbaṃ taṃ tatheva hoti, no aññathā”ti.

pli-tv-kd17:2.2.31.pli: Idāni so moghapuriso attanāva attānaṃ pātukarissati.
pli-tv-kd17:2.2.31.eng: Soon that fool will show himself as he truly is.”

pli-tv-kd17:2.3.0.eng: 3. Discussion of the five kinds of teachers

pli-tv-kd17:2.3.1.pli: Pañcime, moggallāna, satthāro santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
pli-tv-kd17:2.3.1.eng: “Moggallāna, there are five kinds of teachers in the world.

pli-tv-kd17:2.3.3.pli: Idha, moggallāna, ekacco satthā aparisuddhasīlo samāno ‘parisuddhasīlomhī’ti paṭijānāti ‘parisuddhaṃ me sīlaṃ pariyodātaṃ asaṅkiliṭṭhan’ti ca.
pli-tv-kd17:2.3.3.eng: One kind of teacher is impure in behavior, while claiming it is pure.

pli-tv-kd17:2.3.5.pli: ‘ayaṃ kho bhavaṃ satthā aparisuddhasīlo samāno “parisuddhasīlomhī”ti paṭijānāti “parisuddhaṃ me sīlaṃ pariyodātaṃ asaṅkiliṭṭhan”ti ca.

pli-tv-kd17:2.3.6.pli: Mayañceva kho pana gihīnaṃ āroceyyāma, nāssassa manāpaṃ.
pli-tv-kd17:2.3.6.eng: but think, ‘It would be unpleasant for him if we inform the householders.

pli-tv-kd17:2.3.7.pli: Yaṃ kho panassa amanāpaṃ, kathaṃ naṃ mayaṃ tena samudācareyyāma?

pli-tv-kd17:2.3.8.eng: And it’s because of him that we’re honored with gifts of robe-cloth, almsfood, dwellings, and medicinal supplies. How, then, can we inform them?

pli-tv-kd17:2.3.9.pli: yaṃ tumo karissati, tumova tena paññāyissatī’ti.
pli-tv-kd17:2.3.9.eng: He’ll be known through his own actions.’

pli-tv-kd17:2.4.46.pli: na cāhaṃ sāvakehi ñāṇadassanato rakkhaṃ paccāsīsāmī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:2.4.46.eng: and I don’t expect them to do so.”

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā kosambiyaṃ yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena rājagahaṃ tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd17:2.5.1.eng: When the Buddha had stayed at Kosambī for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Rājagaha.

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.2.pli: Anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena rājagahaṃ tadavasari.

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.3.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-kd17:2.5.3.eng: he stayed in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.4.pli: Atha kho sambahulā bhikkhū yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd17:2.5.4.eng: Then a number of monks went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.5.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnā kho te bhikkhū bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.6.pli: “devadattassa, bhante, ajātasattu kumāro pañcahi rathasatehi sāyaṃ pātaṃ upaṭṭhānaṃ gacchati;
pli-tv-kd17:2.5.6.eng: “Sir, Prince Ajātasattu attends on Devadatta morning and evening, with five hundred carriages

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.7.eng: and a meal offering of five hundred dishes of food.”

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.8.eng: “Monks, don’t envy Devadatta his material support, honor, and praise.

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.9.pli: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, devadattassa ajātasattu kumāro pañcahi rathasatehi sāyaṃ pātaṃ upaṭṭhānaṃ gamissati, pañca ca thālipākasatāni bhattābhihāro abhiharīyissati, hāniyeva, bhikkhave, devadattassa pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu, no vuḍḍhi.
pli-tv-kd17:2.5.9.eng: So long as Prince Ajātasattu treats him like this, Devadatta can be expected to decline in good qualities.

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.10.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, caṇḍassa kukkurassa nāsāya pittaṃ bhindeyyuṃ, evañhi so, bhikkhave, kukkuro bhiyyoso mattāya caṇḍataro assa;
pli-tv-kd17:2.5.10.eng: Just as a fierce dog would get even fiercer if you break a gall bladder on its nose,

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.11.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, yāvakīvañca devadattassa ajātasattu kumāro pañcahi rathasatehi sāyaṃ pātaṃ upaṭṭhānaṃ gamissati, pañca ca thālipākasatāni bhattābhihāro abhiharīyissati, hāniyeva, bhikkhave, devadattassa pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu, no vuḍḍhi.
pli-tv-kd17:2.5.11.eng: so too, so long as Prince Ajātasattu treats him like this, Devadatta can be expected to decline in good qualities.

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.12.pli: Attavadhāya, bhikkhave, devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi, parābhavāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi.

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.13.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, kadalī attavadhāya phalaṃ deti, parābhavāya phalaṃ deti;
pli-tv-kd17:2.5.13.eng: Just as a plantain banana tree produces fruit to its own destruction and ruin,

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.14.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, attavadhāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi, parābhavāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi.
pli-tv-kd17:2.5.14.eng: so too will Devadatta’s material support, honor, and praise cause his own destruction and ruin.

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.15.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, veḷu attavadhāya phalaṃ deti, parābhavāya phalaṃ deti;
pli-tv-kd17:2.5.15.eng: Just as a bamboo produces fruit to its own destruction and ruin,

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.16.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, attavadhāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi, parābhavāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi.
pli-tv-kd17:2.5.16.eng: so too will Devadatta’s material support, honor, and praise cause his own destruction and ruin.

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.17.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, naḷo attavadhāya phalaṃ deti, parābhavāya phalaṃ deti;
pli-tv-kd17:2.5.17.eng: Just as a naḷa reed produces fruit to its own destruction and ruin,

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.18.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, attavadhāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi, parābhavāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi.
pli-tv-kd17:2.5.18.eng: so too will Devadatta’s material support, honor, and praise cause his own destruction and ruin.

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.19.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, assatarī attavadhāya gabbhaṃ gaṇhāti, parābhavāya gabbhaṃ gaṇhāti;
pli-tv-kd17:2.5.19.eng: Just as a mule becomes pregnant to its own destruction and ruin,

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.20.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, attavadhāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi, parābhavāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādīti.
pli-tv-kd17:2.5.20.eng: so too will Devadatta’s material support, honor, and praise cause his own destruction and ruin.”

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.22.eng: And the bamboo and the reed.

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.24.eng: As the fetus destroys the mule.”

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.25.eng: The first section for recitation is finished.

pli-tv-kd17:3.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā mahatiyā parisāya parivuto dhammaṃ desento nisinno hoti sarājikāya parisāya.
pli-tv-kd17:3.1.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha was seated giving a teaching surrounded by a large gathering of people, including the king.

pli-tv-kd17:3.1.2.pli: Atha kho devadatto uṭṭhāyāsanā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā tenañjaliṃ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:3.1.2.eng: Devadatta then got up from his seat, arranged his upper robe over one shoulder, raised his joined palms, and said,

pli-tv-kd17:3.1.3.pli: “jiṇṇo dāni, bhante, bhagavā vuḍḍho mahallako addhagato vayoanuppatto.
pli-tv-kd17:3.1.3.eng: “Sir, you’re now old and close to the end of life.

pli-tv-kd17:3.1.4.pli: Appossukko dāni, bhante, bhagavā diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāraṃ anuyutto viharatu, mamaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ nissajjatu.
pli-tv-kd17:3.1.4.eng: You should live free from bother and enjoy the happiness of meditation. Hand the Sangha of monks over to me.

pli-tv-kd17:3.1.6.pli: “Alaṃ, devadatta, mā te rucci bhikkhusaṅghaṃ pariharitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.1.6.eng: “Let it be, Devadatta, don’t think of leading the Sangha of monks.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.1.7.eng: A second time Devadatta said the same thing and got the same reply.

pli-tv-kd17:3.1.8.eng: He then said it a third time,

pli-tv-kd17:3.1.9.pli: “jiṇṇo dāni, bhante, bhagavā vuḍḍho mahallako addhagato vayoanuppatto.

pli-tv-kd17:3.1.10.pli: Appossukko dāni, bhante, bhagavā diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāraṃ anuyutto viharatu, mamaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ nissajjatu.

pli-tv-kd17:3.1.12.pli: “Sāriputtamoggallānānampi kho ahaṃ, devadatta, bhikkhusaṅghaṃ na nissajjeyyaṃ, kiṃ pana tuyhaṃ chavassa kheḷāsakassā”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.1.12.eng: “I wouldn’t even hand the Sangha over to Sāriputta and Mogallāna, so why then to you, a wretched devourer of junk?”
pli-tv-kd17:3.1.12.comm: Kheḷāsaka, literally, “an eater of spittle”. The spittle apparently refers to the material support, honor, and praise he had acquired in an inappropriate manner. Sp 4.336 says: Kheḷāsakassāti ettha micchājīvena uppannapaccayā ariyehi vantabbā kheḷasadisā, tathārūpe paccaye ayaṁ ajjhoharatīti katvā kheḷāsakoti bhagavatā vutto, “Kheḷāsakassa here means that those requisites he had acquired through wrong livelihood, which the noble ones would vomit up like spittle, such requisites he has swallowed down. Kheḷāsakassa was said by the Buddha in this connection.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.1.14.pli: sarājikāya maṃ bhagavā parisāya kheḷāsakavādena apasādeti, sāriputtamoggallāneva ukkaṃsatīti—
pli-tv-kd17:3.1.14.eng: “The Buddha disparages me in front of a gathering that includes the king as a devourer of junk, while praising Sāriputta and Mogallāna,”

pli-tv-kd17:3.1.15.pli: kupito anattamano bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.1.15.eng: and he bowed down in anger, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-kd17:3.1.16.pli: Ayañcarahi devadattassa bhagavati paṭhamo āghāto ahosi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.1.16.eng: This was the first time Devadatta had ill will toward the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.2.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho devadattassa rājagahe pakāsanīyaṃ kammaṃ karotu—
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.2.eng: “Well then, the Sangha should do a legal procedure for the purpose of making an announcement about Devadatta in Rājagaha like this:

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.3.pli: ‘pubbe devadattassa aññā pakati ahosi, idāni aññā pakati.

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.4.pli: Yaṃ devadatto kareyya kāyena vācāya, na tena buddho vā dhammo vā saṅgho vā daṭṭhabbo, devadattova tena daṭṭhabbo’ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.4.eng: Whatever Devadatta now does by body or speech has nothing to do with the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha, but only with Devadatta.’

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.5.eng: And it should be done in this way.

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.6.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.7.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.8.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ saṅgho devadattassa rājagahe pakāsanīyaṃ kammaṃ kareyya—
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.8.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should do a legal procedure for the purpose of making an announcement about Devadatta in Rājagaha like this:

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.9.pli: “pubbe devadattassa aññā pakati ahosi, idāni aññā pakati.

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.10.pli: Yaṃ devadatto kareyya kāyena vācāya, na tena buddho vā dhammo vā saṅgho vā daṭṭhabbo, devadattova tena daṭṭhabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.10.eng: Whatever Devadatta now does by body or speech has nothing to do with the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha, but only with Devadatta.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.12.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.13.pli: Saṅgho devadattassa rājagahe pakāsanīyaṃ kammaṃ karoti—
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.13.eng: The Sangha does a legal procedure  for the purpose of making an announcement about Devadatta in Rājagaha like this:

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.14.pli: “pubbe devadattassa aññā pakati ahosi, idāni aññā pakati.

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.15.pli: Yaṃ devadatto kareyya kāyena vācāya, na tena buddho vā dhammo vā saṅgho vā daṭṭhabbo, devadattova tena daṭṭhabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.15.eng: Whatever Devadatta now does by body or speech has nothing to do with the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha, but only with Devadatta.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.16.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati devadattassa rājagahe pakāsanīyassa kammassa karaṇaṃ—
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.16.eng: Any monk who approves of doing such a legal procedure

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.17.pli: “pubbe devadattassa aññā pakati ahosi, idāni aññā pakati, yaṃ devadatto kareyya kāyena vācāya, na tena buddho vā dhammo vā saṅgho vā daṭṭhabbo, devadattova tena daṭṭhabbo”ti—

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.19.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.20.pli: Kataṃ saṅghena devadattassa rājagahe pakāsanīyaṃ kammaṃ—
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.20.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure for the purpose of making an announcement about Devadatta in Rājagaha like this:

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.21.pli: “pubbe devadattassa aññā pakati ahosi, idāni aññā pakati.

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.22.pli: Yaṃ devadatto kareyya kāyena vācāya, na tena buddho vā dhammo vā saṅgho vā daṭṭhabbo, devadattova tena daṭṭhabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.22.eng: Whatever Devadatta now does by body or speech has nothing to do with the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha, but only with Devadatta.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.23.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.23.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.24.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ āmantesi—

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.25.pli: “tena hi tvaṃ, sāriputta, devadattaṃ rājagahe pakāsehī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.25.eng: “Well then, Sāriputta, make that announcement about Devadatta in Rājagaha.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.26.pli: “Pubbe mayā, bhante, devadattassa rājagahe vaṇṇo bhāsito—
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.26.eng: “In the past, sir, I have praised Devadatta in Rājagaha,

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.28.eng: How, then, can I now make this announcement about him?”

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.29.pli: “Nanu tayā, sāriputta, bhūtoyeva devadattassa rājagahe vaṇṇo bhāsito—

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.32.pli: “Evameva kho tvaṃ, sāriputta, bhūtaṃyeva devadattaṃ rājagahe pakāsehī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.32.eng: “In the same way, you should make this announcement truthfully.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.33.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā sāriputto bhagavato paccassosi.

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.1.eng: The Buddha then addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.2.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho sāriputtaṃ sammannatu devadattaṃ rājagahe pakāsetuṃ—
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.2.eng: “Well then, the Sangha should appoint Sāriputta to make that announcement about Devadatta in Rājagaha.

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.3.pli: ‘pubbe devadattassa aññā pakati ahosi, idāni aññā pakati.

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.4.pli: Yaṃ devadatto kareyya kāyena vācāya, na tena buddho vā dhammo vā saṅgho vā daṭṭhabbo, devadattova tena daṭṭhabbo’ti.

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.5.eng: And he should be appointed like this.

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.7.pli: Yācitvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.7.eng: and then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.8.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.9.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ sammanneyya devadattaṃ rājagahe pakāsetuṃ—
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.9.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should appoint Venerable Sāriputta to make an announcement about Devadatta in Rājagaha like this:

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.10.pli: “pubbe devadattassa aññā pakati ahosi, idāni aññā pakati.

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.11.pli: Yaṃ devadatto kareyya kāyena vācāya, na tena buddho vā dhammo vā saṅgho vā daṭṭhabbo, devadattova tena daṭṭhabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.11.eng: Whatever Devadatta now does by body or speech has nothing to do with the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha, but only with Devadatta.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.13.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.14.pli: Saṅgho āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ sammannati devadattaṃ rājagahe pakāsetuṃ—
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.14.eng: The Sangha appoints Venerable Sāriputta to make an announcement about Devadatta in Rājagaha like this:

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.15.pli: “pubbe devadattassa aññā pakati ahosi, idāni aññā pakati, yaṃ devadatto kareyya kāyena vācāya, na tena buddho vā dhammo vā saṅgho vā daṭṭhabbo, devadattova tena daṭṭhabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.15.eng: “Devadatta’s character has changed. Whatever Devadatta now does by body or speech has nothing to do with the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha, but only with Devadatta.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.16.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati, āyasmato sāriputtassa sammuti devadattaṃ rājagahe pakāsetuṃ—
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.16.eng: Any monk who approves of appointing Venerable Sāriputta in this way

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.17.pli: “pubbe devadattassa aññā pakati ahosi, idāni aññā pakati, yaṃ devadatto kareyya kāyena vācāya, na tena buddho vā dhammo vā saṅgho vā daṭṭhabbo, devadattova tena daṭṭhabbo”ti—

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.19.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.20.pli: Sammato saṅghena āyasmā sāriputto devadattaṃ rājagahe pakāsetuṃ—
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.20.eng: The Sangha has appointed Venerable Sāriputta to make an announcement about Devadatta in Rājagaha like  this:

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.21.pli: “pubbe devadattassa aññā pakati ahosi, idāni aññā pakati.

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.22.pli: Yaṃ devadatto kareyya kāyena vācāya, na tena buddho vā dhammo vā saṅgho vā daṭṭhabbo, devadattova tena daṭṭhabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.22.eng: Whatever Devadatta now does by body or speech has nothing to do with the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha, but only with Devadatta.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.23.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.23.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.24.pli: Sammato ca āyasmā sāriputto sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ rājagahaṃ pavisitvā devadattaṃ rājagahe pakāsesi—
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.24.eng: When he had been appointed, Sāriputta entered Rājagaha accompanied by a number of monks. He then made that announcement about Devadatta:

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.25.pli: “pubbe devadattassa aññā pakati ahosi, idāni aññā pakati.

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.26.pli: Yaṃ devadatto kareyya kāyena vācāya, na tena buddho vā dhammo vā saṅgho vā daṭṭhabbo, devadattova tena daṭṭhabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.26.eng: Whatever Devadatta now does by body or speech has nothing to do with the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha, but only with Devadatta.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.27.pli: Tattha ye te manussā assaddhā appasannā dubbuddhino, te evamāhaṃsu—
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.27.eng: The foolish people there, those with little faith and confidence, said,

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.28.pli: “usūyakā ime samaṇā sakyaputtiyā devadattassa lābhasakkāraṃ usūyantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.28.eng: “These Sakyan monastics are envious of Devadatta’s material support and honor.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.29.pli: Ye pana te manussā saddhā pasannā paṇḍitā byattā buddhimanto, te evamāhaṃsu—
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.29.eng: But the wise ones, those with faith and confidence, said,

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.30.pli: “na kho idaṃ orakaṃ bhavissati yathā bhagavā devadattaṃ rājagahe pakāsāpetī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.30.eng: “This must be a serious matter, seeing as the Buddha has had an announcement made about Devadatta in Rājagaha.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.4.1.pli: Atha kho devadatto yena ajātasattu kumāro tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā ajātasattuṃ kumāraṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:3.4.1.eng: Soon afterwards Devadatta went to Prince Ajātasattu and said,

pli-tv-kd17:3.4.2.pli: “pubbe kho, kumāra, manussā dīghāyukā, etarahi appāyukā.
pli-tv-kd17:3.4.2.eng: “In the past, prince, people were long-lived, but now they’re short-lived.

pli-tv-kd17:3.4.3.pli: Ṭhānaṃ kho panetaṃ vijjati yaṃ tvaṃ kumārova samāno kālaṃ kareyyāsi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.4.3.eng: It’s possible that you might die while still a prince.

pli-tv-kd17:3.4.4.pli: Tena hi tvaṃ, kumāra, pitaraṃ hantvā rājā hohi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.4.4.eng: So then, kill your father and become the king.

pli-tv-kd17:3.4.5.eng: And I’ll kill the Buddha and take his place.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.4.7.pli: “ayyo kho devadatto mahiddhiko mahānubhāvo, jāneyyāsi ayyo devadatto”ti—
pli-tv-kd17:3.4.7.eng: “Venerable Devadatta is powerful and mighty. He would know.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.4.8.pli: ūruyā potthanikaṃ bandhitvā divā divassa bhīto ubbiggo ussaṅkī utrasto sahasā antepuraṃ pāvisi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.4.8.eng: He then bound a dagger to his thigh, and while fearful and agitated, he hastily entered the royal compound in the middle of the day.
pli-tv-kd17:3.4.8.comm: For the rendering “royal compound” for antepura, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd17:3.4.9.pli: Addasāsuṃ kho antepure upacārakā mahāmattā ajātasattuṃ kumāraṃ divā divassa bhītaṃ ubbiggaṃ ussaṅkiṃ utrastaṃ sahasā antepuraṃ pavisantaṃ;
pli-tv-kd17:3.4.9.eng: The officials there saw Ajātasattu’s strange behavior

pli-tv-kd17:3.4.11.pli: Te vicinantā ūruyā potthanikaṃ baddhaṃ disvāna ajātasattuṃ kumāraṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd17:3.4.11.eng: When they examined him, they found the dagger tied to his thigh. They asked him

pli-tv-kd17:3.4.17.pli: “kumāro ca hantabbo, devadatto ca, sabbe ca bhikkhū hantabbā”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.4.17.eng: “The prince should be executed, together with Devadatta and all the monks.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.4.21.eng: The prince should be executed, together with Devadatta.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.4.24.eng: nor the monks should be executed.

pli-tv-kd17:3.4.26.eng: and we should do as he says.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.5.1.pli: Atha kho te mahāmattā ajātasattuṃ kumāraṃ ādāya yena rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā rañño māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd17:3.5.1.eng: They took Ajātasattu with them and went to King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha to inform him of what had happened.

pli-tv-kd17:3.5.2.eng: The king said, “What do you all make of this?”

pli-tv-kd17:3.5.4.pli: ‘kumāro ca hantabbo, devadatto ca, sabbe ca bhikkhū hantabbā’ti.

pli-tv-kd17:3.5.14.pli: “Kiṃ, bhaṇe, karissati buddho vā dhammo vā saṅgho vā?
pli-tv-kd17:3.5.14.eng: The king then said, “What’s this got to do with the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha?

pli-tv-kd17:3.5.15.pli: Nanu bhagavatā paṭikacceva devadatto rājagahe pakāsāpito—
pli-tv-kd17:3.5.15.eng: Didn’t the Buddha have an announcement made in Rājagaha as a warning:

pli-tv-kd17:3.5.16.pli: ‘pubbe devadattassa aññā pakati ahosi, idāni aññā pakati.

pli-tv-kd17:3.5.17.pli: Yaṃ devadatto kareyya kāyena vācāya, na tena buddho vā dhammo vā saṅgho vā daṭṭhabbo, devadattova tena daṭṭhabbo’”ti?
pli-tv-kd17:3.5.17.eng: Whatever Devadatta now does by body or speech has nothing to do with the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha, but only with Devadatta’?”

pli-tv-kd17:3.5.18.pli: Tattha ye te mahāmattā evaṃ matiṃ akaṃsu—
pli-tv-kd17:3.5.18.eng: He then fired those officials who had suggested

pli-tv-kd17:3.5.22.pli: Ye te mahāmattā evaṃ matiṃ akaṃsu—
pli-tv-kd17:3.5.22.eng: he demoted those who had suggested

pli-tv-kd17:3.5.25.eng: to execute the prince and Devadatta;

pli-tv-kd17:3.5.27.pli: Ye te mahāmattā evaṃ matiṃ akaṃsu—
pli-tv-kd17:3.5.27.eng: and he promoted those who had suggested

pli-tv-kd17:3.5.31.eng: to act according to the king’s orders.

pli-tv-kd17:3.5.33.pli: Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro ajātasattuṃ kumāraṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd17:3.5.34.eng: “Why do you want to kill me?”

pli-tv-kd17:3.5.36.pli: “Sace kho tvaṃ, kumāra, rajjena atthiko, etaṃ te rajjan”ti ajātasattussa kumārassa rajjaṃ niyyādesi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.5.36.eng: “If you want to rule, the kingdom is yours.” And he handed the rulership over to the prince.

pli-tv-kd17:3.6.1.pli: Atha kho devadatto yena ajātasattu kumāro tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā ajātasattuṃ kumāraṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:3.6.1.eng: Soon afterwards Devadatta went to Ajātasattu and said,

pli-tv-kd17:3.6.2.pli: “purise, mahārāja, āṇāpehi, ye samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ jīvitā voropessantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.6.2.eng: “Great king, please order your men to kill the ascetic Gotama.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.6.3.pli: Atha kho ajātasattu kumāro manusse āṇāpesi—
pli-tv-kd17:3.6.3.eng: And the king told his men,

pli-tv-kd17:3.6.4.pli: “yathā, bhaṇe, ayyo devadatto āha tathā kareyyāthā”ti.

pli-tv-kd17:3.6.5.pli: Atha kho devadatto ekaṃ purisaṃ āṇāpesi—

pli-tv-kd17:3.6.6.eng: “Go to such and such a place where the ascetic Gotama is staying.

pli-tv-kd17:3.6.7.pli: Taṃ jīvitā voropetvā iminā maggena āgacchā”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.6.7.eng: Kill him and return via that path.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.6.8.eng: On that path he stationed two men, saying,

pli-tv-kd17:3.6.9.pli: “yo iminā maggena eko puriso āgacchati, taṃ jīvitā voropetvā iminā maggena āgacchathā”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.6.9.eng: “Kill the man who comes along this path and return via that path.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.6.10.eng: On that path he stationed four men, saying,

pli-tv-kd17:3.6.11.pli: “ye iminā maggena dve purisā āgacchanti, te jīvitā voropetvā iminā maggena āgacchathā”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.6.11.eng: “Kill the two men who come along this path and return via that path.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.6.12.eng: On that path he stationed eight men, saying,

pli-tv-kd17:3.6.13.pli: “ye iminā maggena cattāro purisā āgacchanti, te jīvitā voropetvā iminā maggena āgacchathā”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.6.13.eng: “Kill the four men who come along this path and return via that path.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.6.14.eng: On that path he stationed sixteen men, saying,

pli-tv-kd17:3.6.15.pli: “ye iminā maggena aṭṭha purisā āgacchanti, te jīvitā voropetvā āgacchathā”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.6.15.eng: “Kill the eight men who come along this path and then return.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.7.1.pli: Atha kho so eko puriso asicammaṃ gahetvā dhanukalāpaṃ sannayhitvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato avidūre bhīto ubbiggo ussaṅkī utrasto patthaddhena kāyena aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.7.1.eng: Soon afterwards that one man armed himself with a bow and arrows, as well as a sword and shield, and went to the Buddha. As he got close, he became fearful and agitated, standing rigidly.

pli-tv-kd17:3.7.2.pli: Addasā kho bhagavā taṃ purisaṃ bhītaṃ ubbiggaṃ ussaṅkiṃ utrastaṃ patthaddhena kāyena ṭhitaṃ.

pli-tv-kd17:3.7.5.pli: Atha kho so puriso asicammaṃ ekamantaṃ karitvā dhanukalāpaṃ nikkhipitvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:3.7.5.eng: He then placed his sword and shield to one side, put down his bow and arrows, and went up to the Buddha. He bowed down with his head at the Buddha’s feet, and said,

pli-tv-kd17:3.7.6.pli: “accayo maṃ, bhante, accagamā yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, yohaṃ duṭṭhacitto vadhakacitto idhūpasaṅkanto.
pli-tv-kd17:3.7.6.eng: “Sir, I’ve made a mistake. I’ve been foolish, confused, and unskillful in coming here with a malicious mind intent on murder.

pli-tv-kd17:3.7.7.pli: Tassa me, bhante, bhagavā accayaṃ accayato paṭiggaṇhātu āyatiṃ saṃvarāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.7.7.eng: Please forgive me so that I may restrain myself in the future.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.7.8.pli: “Taggha tvaṃ, āvuso, accayo accagamā yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, yaṃ tvaṃ duṭṭhacitto vadhakacitto idhūpasaṅkanto.
pli-tv-kd17:3.7.8.eng: “You have certainly made a mistake. You’ve been foolish, confused, and unskillful.

pli-tv-kd17:3.7.9.pli: Yato ca kho tvaṃ, āvuso, accayaṃ accayato disvā yathādhammaṃ paṭikarosi, taṃ te mayaṃ paṭiggaṇhāma.
pli-tv-kd17:3.7.9.eng: But since you acknowledge your mistake and make proper amends, I forgive you.

pli-tv-kd17:3.7.10.eng: For this is called growth in the training of the noble ones:

pli-tv-kd17:3.7.11.pli: yo accayaṃ accayato disvā yathādhammaṃ paṭikaroti, āyatiṃ saṃvaraṃ āpajjatī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.7.11.eng: acknowledging a mistake, making proper amends, and undertaking restraint for the future.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.7.12.pli: Atha kho bhagavā tassa purisassa anupubbiṃ kathaṃ kathesi, seyyathidaṃ—
pli-tv-kd17:3.7.12.eng: The Buddha then gave him a progressive talk—

pli-tv-kd17:3.7.13.pli: dānakathaṃ sīlakathaṃ saggakathaṃ, kāmānaṃ ādīnavaṃ okāraṃ saṅkilesaṃ, nekkhamme ānisaṃsaṃ pakāsesi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.7.13.eng: on generosity, morality, and heaven; on the downside, degradation, and defilement of worldly pleasures; and he revealed the benefits of renunciation.

pli-tv-kd17:3.7.14.pli: Yadā taṃ bhagavā aññāsi kallacittaṃ, muducittaṃ, vinīvaraṇacittaṃ, udaggacittaṃ, pasannacittaṃ, atha yā buddhānaṃ sāmukkaṃsikā dhammadesanā taṃ pakāsesi—
pli-tv-kd17:3.7.14.eng: When the Buddha knew that his mind was ready, supple, without hindrances, joyful, and confident, he revealed the teaching unique to the Buddhas:

pli-tv-kd17:3.7.15.eng: suffering, its origin, its end, and the path.

pli-tv-kd17:3.7.16.pli: Seyyathāpi nāma suddhaṃ vatthaṃ apagatakāḷakaṃ sammadeva rajanaṃ paṭiggaheyya;
pli-tv-kd17:3.7.16.eng: And just as a clean and stainless cloth absorbs dye properly,

pli-tv-kd17:3.7.17.pli: evameva tassa purisassa tasmiṃyeva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi—
pli-tv-kd17:3.7.17.eng: so too, while he was sitting right there, he experienced the stainless vision of the Truth:

pli-tv-kd17:3.7.18.eng: “Anything that has a beginning has an end.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.7.19.pli: Atha kho so puriso diṭṭhadhammo pattadhammo viditadhammo pariyogāḷhadhammo tiṇṇavicikiccho vigatakathaṅkatho vesārajjappatto aparappaccayo satthusāsane bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:3.7.19.eng: He had seen the Truth, had reached, understood, and penetrated it. He had gone beyond doubt and uncertainty, had attained to confidence, and had become independent of others in the Teacher’s instruction. And he said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd17:3.7.21.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya—
pli-tv-kd17:3.7.21.eng: Just as one might set upright what’s overturned, or reveal what’s hidden, or show the way to one who’s lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness

pli-tv-kd17:3.7.22.eng: so that one with eyes might see what’s there—

pli-tv-kd17:3.7.23.eng: just so has the Buddha made the Teaching clear in many ways.

pli-tv-kd17:3.7.24.pli: Esāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavantaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi, dhammañca, bhikkhusaṅghañca.
pli-tv-kd17:3.7.24.eng: I go for refuge to the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-kd17:3.7.25.pli: Upāsakaṃ maṃ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.7.25.eng: Please accept me as a lay follower who’s gone for refuge for life.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.7.26.pli: Atha kho bhagavā taṃ purisaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:3.7.26.eng: The Buddha then said to him,

pli-tv-kd17:3.7.27.pli: “mā kho tvaṃ, āvuso, iminā maggena gaccha, iminā maggena gacchāhī”ti aññena maggena uyyojesi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.7.27.eng: “Don’t go back along this path, go along that one.” And he sent him down a different path.

pli-tv-kd17:3.8.2.pli: “kiṃ nu kho so eko puriso cirena āgacchatī”ti—
pli-tv-kd17:3.8.2.eng: “Why is it taking that one man so long to arrive?”

pli-tv-kd17:3.8.3.pli: paṭipathaṃ gacchantā addasāsuṃ bhagavantaṃ aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle nisinnaṃ.
pli-tv-kd17:3.8.3.eng: As they were walking along that path in the opposite direction, they saw the Buddha seated at the foot of a tree.

pli-tv-kd17:3.8.4.pli: Disvāna yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd17:3.8.4.eng: They approached him, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-kd17:3.8.5.eng: The Buddha gave them a progressive talk …

pli-tv-kd17:3.8.6.eng: and they had become independent of others in the Teacher’s instruction. And they said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd17:3.8.8.pli: upāsake no bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gate”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.8.8.eng: Please accept us as lay followers who have gone for refuge for life.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.8.9.pli: Atha kho bhagavā te purise etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:3.8.9.eng: The Buddha then said to them,

pli-tv-kd17:3.8.10.pli: “mā kho tumhe, āvuso, iminā maggena gacchittha, iminā maggena gacchathā”ti aññena maggena uyyojesi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.8.10.eng: “Don’t go back along this path, go along that one.” And he sent them down a different path.

pli-tv-kd17:3.8.14.pli: kiṃ nu kho te aṭṭha purisā cirena āgacchantīti—
pli-tv-kd17:3.8.14.eng: “Why is it taking those eight men so long to arrive?”

pli-tv-kd17:3.8.15.pli: paṭipathaṃ gacchantā addasāsuṃ bhagavantaṃ aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle nisinnaṃ.
pli-tv-kd17:3.8.15.eng: As they were walking along that path in the opposite direction, they saw the Buddha seated at the foot of a tree.

pli-tv-kd17:3.8.16.pli: Disvāna yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd17:3.8.16.eng: They approached him, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-kd17:3.8.17.pli: Tesaṃ bhagavā anupubbiṃ kathaṃ kathesi, seyyathidaṃ—
pli-tv-kd17:3.8.17.eng: The Buddha gave them a progressive talk …

pli-tv-kd17:3.8.19.eng: and they had become independent of others in the Teacher’s instruction. And they said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd17:3.8.21.pli: upāsake no bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gate”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.8.21.eng: Please accept us as lay followers who have gone for refuge for life.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.8.22.pli: Atha kho bhagavā te purise etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:3.8.22.comm: Here I follow the PTS edition, which does not have this or the next segment. The text means, “The Buddha then said to them, ‘Don’t go back along this path, go along that one.’ And he sent them down a different path”. This seems to be an error in MS based on automatic copying from the previous paragraphs.

pli-tv-kd17:3.8.23.pli: “mā kho tumhe, āvuso, iminā maggena gacchittha, iminā maggena gacchathā”ti aññena maggena uyyojesi.

pli-tv-kd17:3.9.1.pli: Atha kho so eko puriso yena devadatto tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā devadattaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:3.9.1.eng: Soon afterwards that one man went to Devadatta and said,

pli-tv-kd17:3.9.2.pli: “nāhaṃ, bhante, sakkomi taṃ bhagavantaṃ jīvitā voropetuṃ;
pli-tv-kd17:3.9.2.eng: “I wasn’t able to kill him, sir.

pli-tv-kd17:3.9.3.eng: He’s powerful and mighty, that Buddha.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.9.5.pli: mā tvaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ jīvitā voropesi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.9.5.eng: There’s no need for you to kill the ascetic Gotama.

pli-tv-kd17:3.9.7.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā gijjhakūṭassa pabbatassa chāyāyaṃ caṅkamati.
pli-tv-kd17:3.9.7.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha was doing walking meditation in the shade of the Vulture Peak.

pli-tv-kd17:3.9.8.pli: Atha kho devadatto gijjhakūṭaṃ pabbataṃ āruhitvā mahatiṃ silaṃ pavijjhi—
pli-tv-kd17:3.9.8.eng: Devadatta climbed the peak and threw down a large stone, thinking,

pli-tv-kd17:3.9.9.eng: “With this I’ll kill the ascetic Gotama.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.9.10.pli: Dve pabbatakūṭā samāgantvā taṃ silaṃ sampaṭicchiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd17:3.9.10.eng: But the stone got stuck in the junction of two outcrops.

pli-tv-kd17:3.9.11.pli: Tato papatikā uppatitvā bhagavato pāde ruhiraṃ uppādesi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.9.11.eng: A chip flew off, striking the Buddha’s foot and causing him to bleed.

pli-tv-kd17:3.9.12.pli: Atha kho bhagavā uddhaṃ ulloketvā devadattaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:3.9.12.eng: The Buddha looked up and said to Devadatta,

pli-tv-kd17:3.9.13.pli: “bahuṃ tayā, moghapurisa, apuññaṃ pasutaṃ, yaṃ tvaṃ duṭṭhacitto vadhakacitto tathāgatassa ruhiraṃ uppādesī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.9.13.eng: “Foolish man, you’ve made much demerit. With a malicious mind intent on murder you’ve made the Buddha bleed.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.9.14.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd17:3.9.15.pli: “idaṃ, bhikkhave, devadattena paṭhamaṃ ānantariyaṃ kammaṃ upacitaṃ, yaṃ duṭṭhacittena vadhakacittena tathāgatassa ruhiraṃ uppāditan”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.9.15.eng: “With a malicious mind intent on murder Devadatta has made the Buddha bleed. This is his first action with consequences in his very next life.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.2.eng: that Devadatta was trying to murder the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.3.pli: Te ca bhikkhū bhagavato vihārassa parito parito caṅkamanti uccāsaddā mahāsaddā sajjhāyaṃ karontā, bhagavato rakkhāvaraṇaguttiyā.
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.3.eng: they walked back and forth on all sides of the Buddha’s dwelling, trying to protect him by reciting loudly.

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.4.pli: Assosi kho bhagavā uccāsaddaṃ mahāsaddaṃ sajjhāyasaddaṃ.
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.4.eng: The Buddha heard that loud sound of recitation.

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.5.eng: He asked Ānanda what it was,

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.6.pli: “kiṃ nu kho so, ānanda, uccāsaddo mahāsaddo sajjhāyasaddo”ti?

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.9.pli: Te ca, bhante, bhikkhū bhagavato vihārassa parito parito caṅkamanti uccāsaddā mahāsaddā sajjhāyaṃ karontā, bhagavato rakkhāvaraṇaguttiyā.

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.10.pli: So eso, bhagavā, uccāsaddo mahāsaddo sajjhāyasaddo”ti.

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.11.pli: “Tena hānanda, mama vacanena te bhikkhū āmantehi—
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.11.eng: The Buddha said, “Well then, Ānanda, tell those monks in my name

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.13.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paṭissutvā yena te bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā te bhikkhū etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.13.eng: Saying, “Yes, sir,” he did just that.

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.15.pli: “Evamāvuso”ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato ānandassa paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.15.eng: The monks consented. They then went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.16.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinne kho te bhikkhū bhagavā etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.17.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso, yaṃ parūpakkamena tathāgataṃ jīvitā voropeyya.
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.17.eng: “It’s impossible, monks, for anyone to kill me through an act of violence.

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.18.eng: The Buddha won’t attain final extinguishment through an act of violence.

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.19.pli: Pañcime, bhikkhave, satthāro santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.19.eng: Monks, there are five kinds of teachers in the world.

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.21.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco satthā aparisuddhasīlo samāno ‘parisuddhasīlomhī’ti paṭijānāti ‘parisuddhaṃ me sīlaṃ pariyodātaṃ asaṅkiliṭṭhan’ti ca.
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.21.eng: One kind of teacher is impure in behavior, while claiming to be pure.

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.23.pli: ‘ayaṃ kho bhavaṃ satthā aparisuddhasīlo samāno “parisuddhasīlomhī”ti paṭijānāti “parisuddhaṃ me sīlaṃ pariyodātaṃ asaṅkiliṭṭhan”ti ca.

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.24.pli: Mayañceva kho pana gihīnaṃ āroceyyāma, nāssassa manāpaṃ.
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.24.eng: but think, ‘It would be unpleasant for him if we inform the householders.

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.25.pli: Yaṃ kho panassa amanāpaṃ, kathaṃ naṃ mayaṃ tena samudācareyyāma?

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.26.eng: And it’s because of him that we’re honored with gifts of robe-cloth, almsfood, dwellings, and medicinal supplies. How, then, can we inform them?
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.26.comm: The Pali is rather obscure. Vmv 4.334: Sammannatīti cīvarādinā amhākaṁ sammānaṁ karoti, parehi vā ayaṁ satthā sammānīyatīti attho, “Sammannati: the meaning is: he creates honor for us by way of robes, etc., or this teacher is being honored by others.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.27.pli: yaṃ tumo karissati, tumova tena paññāyissatī’ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.27.eng: He’ll be known through his own actions.’

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.28.pli: Evarūpaṃ kho, bhikkhave, satthāraṃ sāvakā sīlato rakkhanti;
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.28.eng: The disciples conceal the impure behavior of such a teacher,

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.29.pli: evarūpo ca pana satthā sāvakehi sīlato rakkhaṃ paccāsīsati.
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.29.eng: and the teacher expects them to do so.

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.30.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idhekacco satthā aparisuddhājīvo samāno …pe…
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.30.eng: Another kind of teacher is impure in livelihood …

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.33.pli: aparisuddhañāṇadassano samāno ‘parisuddhañāṇadassanomhī’ti paṭijānāti ‘parisuddhaṃ me ñāṇadassanaṃ pariyodātaṃ asaṅkiliṭṭhan’ti ca.
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.33.eng: has impure knowledge and vision, while claiming they’re pure.

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.35.pli: ‘ayaṃ kho bhavaṃ satthā aparisuddhañāṇadassano samāno “parisuddhañāṇadassanomhī”ti paṭijānāti “parisuddhaṃ me ñāṇadassanaṃ pariyodātaṃ asaṅkiliṭṭhan”ti ca.

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.36.pli: Mayañceva kho pana gihīnaṃ āroceyyāma, nāssassa manāpaṃ.
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.36.eng: but think, ‘It would be unpleasant for him if we inform the householders.

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.37.pli: Yaṃ kho panassa amanāpaṃ, kathaṃ na mayaṃ tena samudācareyyāma?

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.38.eng: And it’s because of him that we’re honored with gifts of robe-cloth, almsfood, dwellings, and medicinal supplies. How, then, can we inform them?

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.39.pli: yaṃ tumo karissati, tumova tena paññāyissatī’ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.39.eng: He’ll be known through his own actions.’

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.40.pli: Evarūpaṃ kho, bhikkhave, satthāraṃ sāvakā ñāṇadassanato rakkhanti;
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.40.eng: The disciples conceal the impure knowledge and vision of such a teacher,

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.41.pli: evarūpo ca pana satthā sāvakehi ñāṇadassanato rakkhaṃ paccāsīsati.
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.41.eng: and the teacher expects them to do so.

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.42.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca satthāro santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.43.pli: Ahaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, parisuddhasīlo samāno ‘parisuddhasīlomhī’ti paṭijānāmi ‘parisuddhaṃ me sīlaṃ pariyodātaṃ asaṅkiliṭṭhan’ti ca.
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.43.eng: But in my case, I claim my behavior is pure because it is.

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.44.pli: Na ca maṃ sāvakā sīlato rakkhanti;
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.44.eng: My disciples don’t conceal my behavior,

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.45.pli: na cāhaṃ sāvakehi sīlato rakkhaṃ paccāsīsāmi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.45.eng: and I don’t expect them to do so.

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.46.pli: Ahaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, parisuddhājīvo samāno …pe…
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.46.eng: I claim my livelihood is pure …

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.47.eng: I claim my teachings are pure …

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.48.eng: I claim my explanations are pure …

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.49.pli: parisuddhañāṇadassano samāno “parisuddhañāṇadassanomhī”ti paṭijānāmi “parisuddhaṃ me ñāṇadassanaṃ pariyodātaṃ asaṅkiliṭṭhan”ti ca, na ca maṃ sāvakā ñāṇadassanato rakkhanti, na cāhaṃ sāvakehi ñāṇadassanato rakkhaṃ paccāsīsāmi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.49.eng: I claim my knowledge and vision are pure because they are. My disciples don’t conceal my knowledge and vision, and I don’t expect them to do so.

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.50.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso, yaṃ parūpakkamena tathāgataṃ jīvitā voropeyya.
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.50.eng: It’s impossible for anyone to kill me through an act of violence.

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.51.eng: The Buddha won’t attain final extinguishment through an act of violence.

pli-tv-kd17:3.11.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rājagahe nāḷāgiri nāma hatthī caṇḍo hoti, manussaghātako.
pli-tv-kd17:3.11.1.eng: At that time in Rājagaha there was a fierce and man-killing elephant called Nāḷāgiri.

pli-tv-kd17:3.11.2.pli: Atha kho devadatto rājagahaṃ pavisitvā hatthisālaṃ gantvā hatthibhaṇḍe etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:3.11.2.eng: Just then Devadatta entered Rājagaha, went to the elephant stables, and said to the elephant keepers,

pli-tv-kd17:3.11.3.pli: “mayaṃ kho, bhaṇe, rājañātakā nāma paṭibalā nīcaṭṭhāniyaṃ uccaṭṭhāne ṭhapetuṃ, bhattampi vetanampi vaḍḍhāpetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd17:3.11.3.eng: “We who are relatives of the king are capable of having people promoted and getting them a raise.

pli-tv-kd17:3.11.4.pli: Tena hi, bhaṇe, yadā samaṇo gotamo imaṃ racchaṃ paṭipanno hoti, tadā imaṃ nāḷāgiriṃ hatthiṃ muñcetvā imaṃ racchaṃ paṭipādethā”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.11.4.eng: So then, when the ascetic Gotama comes walking along this street, release the elephant Nāḷāgiri down it.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.11.5.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho te hatthibhaṇḍā devadattassa paccassosuṃ.

pli-tv-kd17:3.11.6.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ rājagahaṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.11.6.eng: Then, one morning, the Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and entered Rājagaha for alms together with a number of monks.

pli-tv-kd17:3.11.7.pli: Atha kho bhagavā taṃ racchaṃ paṭipajji.
pli-tv-kd17:3.11.7.eng: And the Buddha walked down that very street.

pli-tv-kd17:3.11.8.pli: Addasāsuṃ kho te hatthibhaṇḍā bhagavantaṃ taṃ racchaṃ paṭipannaṃ.
pli-tv-kd17:3.11.8.eng: When the elephant keepers saw the Buddha coming,

pli-tv-kd17:3.11.9.pli: Disvāna nāḷāgiriṃ hatthiṃ muñcitvā taṃ racchaṃ paṭipādesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd17:3.11.9.eng: they released Nāḷāgiri down the same street.

pli-tv-kd17:3.11.10.pli: Addasā kho nāḷāgiri hatthī bhagavantaṃ dūratova āgacchantaṃ.

pli-tv-kd17:3.11.11.pli: Disvāna soṇḍaṃ ussāpetvā pahaṭṭhakaṇṇavālo yena bhagavā tena abhidhāvi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.11.11.eng: He blew his trunk, and with ears and tail bristling, he charged toward the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd17:3.11.12.pli: Addasāsuṃ kho te bhikkhū nāḷāgiriṃ hatthiṃ dūratova āgacchantaṃ.
pli-tv-kd17:3.11.12.eng: When the monks saw Nāḷāgiri coming,

pli-tv-kd17:3.11.14.pli: “ayaṃ, bhante, nāḷāgiri hatthī caṇḍo manussaghātako imaṃ racchaṃ paṭipanno.
pli-tv-kd17:3.11.14.eng: “This elephant coming down the street is the fierce, man-killer Nāḷāgiri.

pli-tv-kd17:3.11.18.pli: Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso, yaṃ parūpakkamena tathāgataṃ jīvitā voropeyya.
pli-tv-kd17:3.11.18.eng: It’s impossible for anyone to kill the Buddha through an act of violence.

pli-tv-kd17:3.11.19.eng: The Buddha won’t attain final extinguishment through an act of violence.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.11.21.pli: tatiyampi kho te bhikkhū bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd17:3.11.21.eng: and a third time those monks said the same thing to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd17:3.11.22.pli: “ayaṃ, bhante, nāḷāgiri hatthī caṇḍo manussaghātako imaṃ racchaṃ paṭipanno.

pli-tv-kd17:3.11.25.eng: each time getting the same reply.

pli-tv-kd17:3.11.26.pli: Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso, yaṃ parūpakkamena tathāgataṃ jīvitā voropeyya.

pli-tv-kd17:3.12.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena manussā pāsādesupi hammiyesupi chadanesupi āruḷhā acchanti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.12.1.eng: On that occasion people had ascended their stilt houses and even their roofs.

pli-tv-kd17:3.12.2.pli: Tattha ye te manussā assaddhā appasannā dubbuddhino, te evamāhaṃsu—
pli-tv-kd17:3.12.2.eng: The foolish people with little faith and confidence said,

pli-tv-kd17:3.12.3.eng: “The elephant will hurt the handsome, great ascetic.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.12.4.pli: Ye pana te manussā saddhā pasannā paṇḍitā byattā buddhimanto, te evamāhaṃsu—
pli-tv-kd17:3.12.4.eng: But the wise people with faith and confidence said,

pli-tv-kd17:3.12.5.eng: “Soon the great man and the great elephant will meet in battle.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.12.6.pli: Atha kho bhagavā nāḷāgiriṃ hatthiṃ mettena cittena phari.
pli-tv-kd17:3.12.6.eng: The Buddha then pervaded Nāḷāgiri with a mind of love.

pli-tv-kd17:3.12.7.pli: Atha kho nāḷāgiri hatthī bhagavato mettena cittena phuṭṭho soṇḍaṃ oropetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato purato aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.12.7.eng: Feeling it, Nāḷāgiri lowered his trunk, went up to the Buddha, and stood in front of him.

pli-tv-kd17:3.12.8.pli: Atha kho bhagavā dakkhiṇena hatthena nāḷāgirissa hatthissa kumbhaṃ parāmasanto nāḷāgiriṃ hatthiṃ imāhi gāthāhi ajjhabhāsi—
pli-tv-kd17:3.12.8.eng: And while stroking Nāḷāgiri on the forehead with his right hand, the Buddha spoke these verses:

pli-tv-kd17:3.12.9.eng: “Do not, elephant, attack a great man;

pli-tv-kd17:3.12.10.eng: Painful it is to attack a great man.

pli-tv-kd17:3.12.11.eng: For a killer of a great man,

pli-tv-kd17:3.12.12.eng: The next birth is not good.

pli-tv-kd17:3.12.13.pli: Mā ca mado mā ca pamādo,

pli-tv-kd17:3.12.14.pli: Na hi pamattā sugatiṃ vajanti te;
pli-tv-kd17:3.12.14.eng: For the heedless are not happily reborn.

pli-tv-kd17:3.12.16.eng: That take you to a good destination.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.12.17.pli: Atha kho nāḷāgiri hatthī soṇḍāya bhagavato pādapaṃsūni gahetvā uparimuddhani ākiritvā paṭikuṭiyova osakki, yāva bhagavantaṃ addakkhi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.12.17.eng: Nāḷāgiri sucked the dust from the Buddha’s feet with his trunk and scattered it overhead. He then walked backward while looking at the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd17:3.12.18.pli: Atha kho nāḷāgiri hatthī hatthisālaṃ gantvā sake ṭhāne aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.12.18.eng: and returned to his stall in the elephant stables.

pli-tv-kd17:3.12.19.pli: Tathā danto ca pana nāḷāgiri hatthī ahosi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.12.19.eng: That is how tame Nāḷāgiri had become.

pli-tv-kd17:3.12.20.pli: Tena kho pana samayena manussā imaṃ gāthaṃ gāyanti—
pli-tv-kd17:3.12.20.eng: On that occasion people chanted this verse:

pli-tv-kd17:3.12.22.eng: And some with goads and whips.

pli-tv-kd17:3.12.24.eng: The great sage tamed the elephant.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.13.1.eng: And people complained and criticized Devadatta,

pli-tv-kd17:3.13.2.pli: “yāva pāpo ayaṃ devadatto, alakkhiko, yatra hi nāma samaṇassa gotamassa evaṃmahiddhikassa evaṃmahānubhāvassa vadhāya parakkamissatī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.13.2.eng: “How evil and indiscriminate he is, this Devadatta, in trying to kill the ascetic Gotama so powerful and mighty!”
pli-tv-kd17:3.13.2.comm: Sp 4.342: Alakkhikoti ettha na lakkhetīti alakkhiko; na jānātīti attho, ahaṁ pāpakammaṁ karomīti na jānāti, “Alakkhika: here alakkhika means ʻOne does not distinguish’. The meaning is ʻHe does not know’. He does not know ʻI am making bad karma’.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.13.3.eng: Devadatta’s material support and honor declined,

pli-tv-kd17:3.13.4.eng: whereas those of the Buddha increased.

pli-tv-kd17:3.13.5.0.eng: 9. The account of the request for the five points

pli-tv-kd17:3.13.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena devadatto parihīnalābhasakkāro sapariso kulesu viññāpetvā viññāpetvā bhuñjati.
pli-tv-kd17:3.13.5.1.eng: Because of his loss of material support and honor, Devadatta and his followers had to ask families repeatedly to get invited to meals.
pli-tv-kd17:3.13.5.1.comm: Sp 2.209: Kulesu viññāpetvā viññāpetvā bhuñjatīti “mā me gaṇo bhijjī”ti parisaṁ posento “tvaṁ ekassa bhikkhuno bhattaṁ dehi, tvaṁ dvinna”nti evaṁ viññāpetvā sapariso kulesu bhuñjati, “Kulesu viññāpetvā viññāpetvā bhuñjati: thinking, ʻMay my group not split,’ he looks after his group, saying, ʻYou give food to one monk; you to two.’ Having asked families in this way, he eats together with his followers.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.13.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā kulesu viññāpetvā viññāpetvā bhuñjissanti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.13.7.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics repeatedly ask families to get invited to meals?

pli-tv-kd17:3.13.8.pli: Kassa sampannaṃ na manāpaṃ, kassa sāduṃ na ruccatī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.13.8.eng: Who doesn’t like nice food? Who doesn’t prefer tasty food?”

pli-tv-kd17:3.13.9.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-kd17:3.13.9.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-kd17:3.13.10.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd17:3.13.10.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-kd17:3.13.11.pli: “kathañhi nāma devadatto sapariso kulesu viññāpetvā viññāpetvā bhuñjissatī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.13.11.eng: “How can Devadatta and his followers repeatedly ask families to get invited to meals?”

pli-tv-kd17:3.13.12.eng: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:

pli-tv-kd17:3.13.13.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, devadatta, sapariso kulesu viññāpetvā viññāpetvā bhuñjasī”ti?
pli-tv-kd17:3.13.13.eng: “Is it true, Devadatta, that you do this?”

pli-tv-kd17:3.13.16.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd17:3.13.17.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ kulesu tikabhojanaṃ paññapessāmi tayo atthavase paṭicca—
pli-tv-kd17:3.13.17.eng: “Well then, for monks eating among families, I’ll lay down a rule against eating in groups of more than three, for these three reasons:

pli-tv-kd17:3.13.18.eng: for the restraint of bad people;

pli-tv-kd17:3.13.19.pli: pesalānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ phāsuvihārāya, ‘mā pāpicchā pakkhaṃ nissāya saṅghaṃ bhindeyyun’ti;
pli-tv-kd17:3.13.19.eng: for the ease of good monks, stopping those with bad desires from creating a faction and then a schism in the Sangha;

pli-tv-kd17:3.13.20.eng: and out of compassion for families.

pli-tv-kd17:3.13.21.eng: Anyone eating in a group is to be dealt with according to the rule.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.14.1.pli: Atha kho devadatto yena kokāliko kaṭamodakatissako khaṇḍadeviyā putto samuddadatto tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā kokālikaṃ kaṭamodakatissakaṃ khaṇḍadeviyā puttaṃ samuddadattaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:3.14.1.eng: Soon afterwards Devadatta went to Kokālika, Kaṭamodakatissaka, Khaṇḍadeviyāputta, and Samuddadatta. He said to them,

pli-tv-kd17:3.14.2.pli: “etha, mayaṃ, āvuso, samaṇassa gotamassa saṅghabhedaṃ karissāma cakkabhedan”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.14.2.eng: “Let’s cause a schism in the Sangha of the ascetic Gotama. Let’s break its authority.”
pli-tv-kd17:3.14.2.comm: “Break its authority” renders cakkabheda. Sp 3.410: Cakkabhedāyāti āṇābhedāya, “Cakkabheda: by breaking the authority.” Vjb 4.343: Cakkabhedanti sāsanabhedaṁ, “Cakkabheda: a break in the instruction.” The break in authority is presumably both from the Buddha and the Sangha. Although the Buddha was the only authority in laying down rules, the Sangha was autonomous in its decision making. For practical purposes, it was the Sangha that Devadatta was breaking with.

pli-tv-kd17:3.14.4.eng: “The ascetic Gotama is powerful and mighty.

pli-tv-kd17:3.14.5.pli: Kathaṃ mayaṃ samaṇassa gotamassa saṅghabhedaṃ karissāma cakkabhedan”ti?

pli-tv-kd17:3.14.6.pli: “Etha, mayaṃ, āvuso, samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ upasaṅkamitvā pañca vatthūni yācissāma—
pli-tv-kd17:3.14.6.eng: “Well, let’s go to the ascetic Gotama and request five things:

pli-tv-kd17:3.14.7.pli: ‘bhagavā, bhante, anekapariyāyena appicchassa santuṭṭhassa sallekhassa dhutassa pāsādikassa apacayassa vīriyārambhassa vaṇṇavādī.
pli-tv-kd17:3.14.7.eng: ‘In many ways, sir, you praise fewness of wishes, contentment, self-effacement, ascetic practices, being inspiring, the reduction in things, and being energetic.

pli-tv-kd17:3.14.8.pli: Imāni, bhante, pañca vatthūni anekapariyāyena appicchatāya santuṭṭhiyā sallekhāya dhutatāya pāsādikatāya apacayāya vīriyārambhāya saṃvattanti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.14.8.eng: And there are five things that lead to just that:

pli-tv-kd17:3.14.9.pli: Sādhu, bhante, bhikkhū yāvajīvaṃ āraññikā assu; yo gāmantaṃ osareyya, vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyya.
pli-tv-kd17:3.14.9.eng: It would be good, sir, if the monks stayed in the wilderness for life, and whoever stayed near an inhabited area would commit an offense;
pli-tv-kd17:3.14.9.comm: For the rendering “inhabited area” for gāma, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd17:3.14.10.pli: Yāvajīvaṃ piṇḍapātikā assu; yo nimantanaṃ sādiyeyya, vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyya.
pli-tv-kd17:3.14.10.eng: if they ate only almsfood for life, and whoever accepted an invitational meal would commit an offense;

pli-tv-kd17:3.14.11.pli: Yāvajīvaṃ paṃsukūlikā assu; yo gahapaticīvaraṃ sādiyeyya, vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyya.
pli-tv-kd17:3.14.11.eng: if they wore rag-robes for life, and whoever accepted robe-cloth from a householder would commit an offense;

pli-tv-kd17:3.14.12.pli: Yāvajīvaṃ rukkhamūlikā assu; yo channaṃ upagaccheyya, vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyya.
pli-tv-kd17:3.14.12.eng: if they lived at the foot of a tree for life, and whoever took shelter would commit an offense;

pli-tv-kd17:3.14.13.pli: Yāvajīvaṃ macchamaṃsaṃ na khādeyyuṃ; yo macchamaṃsaṃ khādeyya, vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyyā’ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.14.13.eng: if they didn’t eat fish or meat for life, and whoever did would commit an offense.’

pli-tv-kd17:3.14.14.pli: Imāni pañca vatthūni samaṇo gotamo nānujānissati.
pli-tv-kd17:3.14.14.eng: The ascetic Gotama won’t allow this.

pli-tv-kd17:3.14.15.pli: Te mayaṃ imehi pañcahi vatthūhi janaṃ saññāpessāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.14.15.eng: We’ll then be able to win people over with these five points.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.14.16.pli: “Sakkā kho, āvuso, imehi pañcahi vatthūhi samaṇassa gotamassa saṅghabhedo kātuṃ cakkabhedo.
pli-tv-kd17:3.14.16.eng: Kokālika said, “It might be possible to cause a schism in the Sangha with these five points,

pli-tv-kd17:3.14.17.eng: for people have confidence in austerity.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.1.pli: Atha kho devadatto sapariso yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.15.1.eng: Devadatta and his followers then went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho devadatto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.3.pli: “bhagavā, bhante, anekapariyāyena appicchassa santuṭṭhassa sallekhassa dhutassa pāsādikassa apacayassa vīriyārambhassa vaṇṇavādī.

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.4.pli: Imāni, bhante, pañca vatthūni anekapariyāyena appicchatāya santuṭṭhiyā sallekhāya dhutatāya pāsādikatāya apacayāya vīriyārambhāya saṃvattanti.

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.5.pli: Sādhu, bhante, bhikkhū yāvajīvaṃ āraññikā assu; yo gāmantaṃ osareyya, vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyya.

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.6.pli: Yāvajīvaṃ piṇḍapātikā assu; yo nimantanaṃ sādiyeyya, vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyya.

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.7.pli: Yāvajīvaṃ paṃsukūlikā assu; yo gahapaticīvaraṃ sādiyeyya, vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyya.

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.8.pli: Yāvajīvaṃ rukkhamūlikā assu; yo channaṃ upagaccheyya, vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyya.
