pli-tv-kd17:3.15.9.pli: Yāvajīvaṃ macchamaṃsaṃ na khādeyyuṃ; yo macchamaṃsaṃ khādeyya, vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyyā”ti.

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.11.pli: Yo icchati, āraññiko hotu; yo icchati, gāmante viharatu.
pli-tv-kd17:3.15.11.eng: Those who wish may stay in the wilderness and those who wish may live near inhabited areas.

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.12.pli: Yo icchati, piṇḍapātiko hotu; yo icchati, nimantanaṃ sādiyatu.
pli-tv-kd17:3.15.12.eng: Those who wish may eat only almsfood and those who wish may accept invitations.

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.13.pli: Yo icchati, paṃsukūliko hotu; yo icchati, gahapaticīvaraṃ sādiyatu.
pli-tv-kd17:3.15.13.eng: Those who wish may wear rag-robes and those who wish may accept robe-cloth from householders.

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.14.pli: Aṭṭhamāse kho mayā, devadatta, rukkhamūlasenāsanaṃ anuññātaṃ;
pli-tv-kd17:3.15.14.eng: I have allowed the foot of a tree as a resting place for eight months of the year,
pli-tv-kd17:3.15.14.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “resting place” for senāsana, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.15.eng: as well as fish and meat that are pure in three respects:

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.16.eng: one hasn’t seen, heard, or suspected that the animal was specifically killed to feed a monastic.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.18.eng: “The Buddha doesn’t allow the five points.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.19.pli: haṭṭho udaggo sapariso uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.15.19.eng: Glad and elated, he got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left with his followers.

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.20.pli: Atha kho devadatto sapariso rājagahaṃ pavisitvā pañcahi vatthūhi janaṃ saññāpesi—
pli-tv-kd17:3.15.20.eng: Devadatta then entered Rājagaha and won people over with the five points,

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.21.pli: “mayaṃ, āvuso, samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ upasaṅkamitvā pañca vatthūni yācimhā—

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.24.pli: Imāni, bhante, pañca vatthūni anekapariyāyena appicchatāya …pe…

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.26.pli: Sādhu, bhante, bhikkhū yāvajīvaṃ āraññikā assu; yo gāmantaṃ osareyya, vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyya …pe…

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.27.pli: yāvajīvaṃ macchamaṃsaṃ na khādeyyuṃ; yo macchamaṃsaṃ khādeyya, vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyyā’ti.

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.28.pli: Imāni pañca vatthūni samaṇo gotamo nānujānāti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.15.28.eng: saying, “The ascetic Gotama doesn’t agree to them,

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.29.pli: Te mayaṃ imehi pañcahi vatthūhi samādāya vattāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.15.29.eng: but we practice in accordance with them.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.16.1.pli: Tattha ye te manussā assaddhā appasannā dubbuddhino, te evamāhaṃsu—
pli-tv-kd17:3.16.1.eng: The foolish people with little faith and confidence said,

pli-tv-kd17:3.16.2.eng: “These Sakyan monastics are practicing asceticism and living with the aim of self-effacement.

pli-tv-kd17:3.16.3.pli: Samaṇo pana gotamo bāhulliko bāhullāya cetetī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.16.3.eng: But the ascetic Gotama is extravagant and has chosen a life of indulgence.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.16.4.pli: Ye pana te manussā saddhā pasannā paṇḍitā byattā buddhimanto, te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd17:3.16.4.eng: But the wise people who had faith and confidence complained and criticized Devadatta,

pli-tv-kd17:3.16.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma devadatto bhagavato saṅghabhedāya parakkamissati cakkabhedāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.16.5.eng: “How can Devadatta pursue schism in the Sangha of the Buddha? How can he break its authority?”

pli-tv-kd17:3.16.6.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-kd17:3.16.6.eng: The monks heard the criticism of those people,

pli-tv-kd17:3.16.7.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd17:3.16.7.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized him in the same way.

pli-tv-kd17:3.16.9.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-kd17:3.16.9.eng: They then told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:

pli-tv-kd17:3.16.10.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, devadatta, saṅghabhedāya parakkamasi cakkabhedāyā”ti?
pli-tv-kd17:3.16.10.eng: “Is it true, Devadatta, that you are doing this?”

pli-tv-kd17:3.16.13.eng: don’t cause a schism in the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd17:3.16.14.eng: Schism in the Sangha is a serious matter.

pli-tv-kd17:3.16.15.pli: Yo kho, devadatta, samaggaṃ saṅghaṃ bhindati, kappaṭṭhikaṃ kibbisaṃ pasavati, kappaṃ nirayamhi paccati.
pli-tv-kd17:3.16.15.eng: Whoever causes a schism in a united Sangha does a bad act with effect for an eon. He’s boiled in hell for an eon.

pli-tv-kd17:3.16.16.pli: Yo ca kho, devadatta, bhinnaṃ saṅghaṃ samaggaṃ karoti, brahmaṃ puññaṃ pasavati, kappaṃ saggamhi modati.
pli-tv-kd17:3.16.16.eng: But whoever unites a divided Sangha generates the supreme merit. He rejoices in heaven for an eon.

pli-tv-kd17:3.16.18.eng: don’t cause a schism in the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd17:3.17.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya rājagahaṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.17.1.eng: Soon afterwards, Venerable Ānanda robed up in the morning, took his bowl and robe, and entered Rājagaha for alms.

pli-tv-kd17:3.17.2.pli: Addasā kho devadatto āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ rājagahe piṇḍāya carantaṃ.

pli-tv-kd17:3.17.3.pli: Disvāna yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:3.17.3.eng: he went up to him, and said,

pli-tv-kd17:3.17.4.pli: “ajjataggedānāhaṃ, āvuso ānanda, aññatreva bhagavatā, aññatreva bhikkhusaṅghā, uposathaṃ karissāmi saṅghakammaṃ karissāmī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.17.4.eng: “From today on, Ānanda, I’ll do the observance-day ceremony and the legal procedures of the Sangha separate from the Buddha and the Sangha of monks.”
pli-tv-kd17:3.17.4.comm: For the rendering “observance-day ceremony” for uposatha, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd17:3.17.5.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando rājagahe piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.17.5.eng: When Ānanda had completed his almsround, eaten his meal, and returned, he went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd17:3.17.6.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:3.17.6.eng: and told him what had happened,

pli-tv-kd17:3.17.7.pli: “idhāhaṃ, bhante, pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya rājagahaṃ piṇḍāya pāvisiṃ.

pli-tv-kd17:3.17.8.pli: Addasā kho maṃ, bhante, devadatto rājagahe piṇḍāya carantaṃ.

pli-tv-kd17:3.17.9.pli: Disvāna yenāhaṃ tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā maṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd17:3.17.10.pli: ‘ajjataggedānāhaṃ, āvuso ānanda, aññatreva bhagavatā, aññatreva bhikkhusaṅghā, uposathaṃ karissāmi saṅghakammaṃ karissāmī’ti.

pli-tv-kd17:3.17.11.eng: adding, “From today, sir, Devadatta has caused a schism in the Sangha.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.17.12.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etamatthaṃ viditvā tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imaṃ udānaṃ udānesi—
pli-tv-kd17:3.17.12.eng: Understanding the significance of this, on that occasion the Buddha uttered a heartfelt exclamation:

pli-tv-kd17:3.17.13.eng: “For the good, doing good is easy;

pli-tv-kd17:3.17.14.eng: For the bad, doing good is hard.

pli-tv-kd17:3.17.15.eng: For the bad, doing evil is easy;

pli-tv-kd17:3.17.16.eng: For the noble ones, doing evil is hard.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.17.17.eng: The second section for recitation is finished.

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.0.2.eng: 3.1 The account of schism in the Sangha

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.1.pli: Atha kho devadatto tadahuposathe uṭṭhāyāsanā salākaṃ gāhesi—
pli-tv-kd17:4.1.1.eng: On the observance day soon afterwards, Devadatta got up from his seat and distributed ballots, saying,

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.2.pli: “mayaṃ, āvuso, samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ upasaṅkamitvā pañca vatthūni yācimhā—
pli-tv-kd17:4.1.2.eng: “We have gone to the ascetic Gotama and asked for five things:

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.3.eng: ‘In many ways, sir, you praise fewness of wishes, contentment, self-effacement, ascetic practices, being inspiring, the reduction in things,

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.5.pli: Imāni, bhante, pañca vatthūni anekapariyāyena appicchatāya …pe…
pli-tv-kd17:4.1.5.eng: And there are five things that lead to just that:

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.7.1.pli: Sādhu, bhante, bhikkhū yāvajīvaṃ āraññikā assu; yo gāmantaṃ osareyya, vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyya …pe…
pli-tv-kd17:4.1.7.1.eng: It would be good, sir, if the monks stayed in the wilderness for life, and whoever stayed near inhabited areas would commit an offense;

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.7.2.eng: if they were alms-collectors for life, and whoever accepted an invitation would commit an offense;

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.7.3.eng: if they were rag-robe wearers for life, and whoever accepted robe-cloth from a householder would commit an offense;

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.7.4.eng: if they dwelt at the foot of a tree for life, and whoever took shelter would commit an offense;

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.8.pli: yāvajīvaṃ macchamaṃsaṃ na khādeyyuṃ; yo macchamaṃsaṃ khādeyya, vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyyā’ti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.1.8.eng: if they didn’t eat fish or meat for life, and whoever did would commit an offense.’

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.9.pli: Imāni pañca vatthūni samaṇo gotamo nānujānāti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.1.9.eng: The ascetic Gotama doesn’t agree to them,

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.10.pli: Te mayaṃ imehi pañcahi vatthūhi samādāya vattāma.
pli-tv-kd17:4.1.10.eng: but we practice in accordance with them.

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.11.pli: Yassāyasmato imāni pañca vatthūni khamanti, so salākaṃ gaṇhātū”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.1.11.eng: Any monk who approves of these five things should vote in favor.”

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.12.pli: Tena kho pana samayena vesālikā vajjiputtakā pañcamattāni bhikkhusatāni navakā ceva honti appakataññuno ca.
pli-tv-kd17:4.1.12.eng: On that occasion five hundred Vajjian monks from Vesālī, newly ordained and ignorant, were present.

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.13.pli: Te—“ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanan”ti salākaṃ gaṇhiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd17:4.1.13.eng: Thinking, “This is the Teaching, this is the Monastic Law, this is the Teacher’s instruction,” they voted in favor.

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.14.pli: Atha kho devadatto saṅghaṃ bhinditvā pañcamattāni bhikkhusatāni ādāya yena gayāsīsaṃ tena pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd17:4.1.14.eng: Then, after causing a schism in the Sangha, Devadatta left for Gayāsīsa together with the five hundred monks.

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.15.pli: Atha kho sāriputtamoggallānā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd17:4.1.15.eng: Soon afterwards Sāriputta and Moggallāna went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.16.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā sāriputto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.17.pli: “devadatto, bhante, saṅghaṃ bhinditvā pañcamattāni bhikkhusatāni ādāya yena gayāsīsaṃ tena pakkanto”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.1.17.eng: “Sir, Devadatta has split the Sangha and left for Gayāsīsa together with five hundred monks.”

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.18.pli: “Na hi nāma tumhākaṃ, sāriputtā, tesu navakesu bhikkhūsu kāruññampi bhavissati?
pli-tv-kd17:4.1.18.eng: “You have compassion for those five hundred newly ordained monks, don’t you?

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.19.pli: Gacchatha tumhe, sāriputtā, purā te bhikkhū anayabyasanaṃ āpajjantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.1.19.eng: Go then, Sāriputta and Moggallāna, before they’re afflicted with misfortune and disaster.”

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.20.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho sāriputtamoggallānā bhagavato paṭissutvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā yena gayāsīsaṃ tenupasaṅkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd17:4.1.20.eng: Saying, “Yes, sir,” they got up from their seats, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with their right sides toward him, and went to Gayāsīsa.

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.21.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu bhagavato avidūre rodamāno ṭhito hoti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.1.21.eng: Just then a certain monk who was standing near the Buddha was crying.

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.22.pli: Atha kho bhagavā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.24.pli: “Yepi te, bhante, bhagavato aggasāvakā sāriputtamoggallānā tepi devadattassa santike gacchanti devadattassa dhammaṃ rocentā”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.1.24.eng: He said, “Sir, even Sāriputta and Moggallāna, the Buddha’s chief disciples, are going to Devadatta because they approve of his teaching.”

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.25.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhu, anavakāso, yaṃ sāriputtamoggallānā devadattassa dhammaṃ roceyyuṃ, api ca te gatā bhikkhūnaṃ saññattiyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.1.25.eng: “It’s impossible for Sāriputta and Moggallāna to approve of Devadatta’s teaching. In fact, they’ve gone to win those monks over.”

pli-tv-kd17:4.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena devadatto mahatiyā parisāya parivuto dhammaṃ desento nisinno hoti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.2.1.eng: At that time Devadatta was seated giving a teaching surrounded by a large gathering.

pli-tv-kd17:4.2.2.pli: Addasā kho devadatto sāriputtamoggallāne dūratova āgacchante.
pli-tv-kd17:4.2.2.eng: When Devadatta saw Sāriputta and Moggallāna coming,

pli-tv-kd17:4.2.4.pli: “passatha, bhikkhave, yāva svākkhāto mayā dhammo, yepi te samaṇassa gotamassa aggasāvakā sāriputtamoggallānā tepi mama santike āgacchanti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.2.4.eng: “See how well-taught my teaching is, as even Sāriputta and Moggallāna, the ascetic Gotama’s chief disciples, are coming here

pli-tv-kd17:4.2.8.pli: Pāpicchā sāriputtamoggallānā, pāpikānaṃ icchānaṃ vasaṃ gatā”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.2.8.eng: They have bad desires. They’re in the grip of bad desires.”

pli-tv-kd17:4.2.10.pli: Svāgataṃ tesaṃ yato me dhammaṃ rocentī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.2.10.eng: Anyone who comes to approve of my teaching is welcome.”

pli-tv-kd17:4.2.11.pli: Atha kho devadatto āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ upaḍḍhāsanena nimantesi—

pli-tv-kd17:4.2.12.eng: to sit on a seat half the height of his own.

pli-tv-kd17:4.2.13.pli: “Alaṃ, āvuso”ti kho āyasmā sāriputto aññataraṃ āsanaṃ gahetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd17:4.2.13.eng: Saying, “There’s no need,” Sāriputta took another seat and sat down to one side,

pli-tv-kd17:4.2.14.pli: Āyasmāpi kho mahāmoggallāno aññataraṃ āsanaṃ gahetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.

pli-tv-kd17:4.2.15.pli: Atha kho devadatto bahudeva rattiṃ bhikkhū dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ ajjhesi—
pli-tv-kd17:4.2.15.eng: After spending most of the night instructing, inspiring, and gladdening the monks with a teaching, Devadatta invited Sāriputta, saying

pli-tv-kd17:4.2.16.eng: “The Sangha of monks is without dullness and drowsiness.

pli-tv-kd17:4.2.17.pli: Paṭibhātu taṃ, āvuso sāriputta, bhikkhūnaṃ dhammī kathā, piṭṭhi me āgilāyati, tamahaṃ āyamissāmī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.2.17.eng: Give a teaching, Sāriputta. My back is aching. I need to stretch it.”

pli-tv-kd17:4.2.19.pli: Atha kho devadatto catugguṇaṃ saṅghāṭiṃ paññapetvā dakkhiṇena passena seyyaṃ kappesi.
pli-tv-kd17:4.2.19.eng: Devadatta then folded his upper robe in four and lay down on his right side.

pli-tv-kd17:4.2.20.pli: Tassa kilamantassa muṭṭhassatissa asampajānassa muhuttakeneva niddā okkami.
pli-tv-kd17:4.2.20.eng: Because he was tired, absentminded, and heedless, he fell asleep immediately.

pli-tv-kd17:4.3.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto ādesanāpāṭihāriyānusāsaniyā bhikkhū dhammiyā kathāya ovadi anusāsi.
pli-tv-kd17:4.3.1.eng: Venerable Sāriputta then used the wonder of mind reading to instruct those monks,

pli-tv-kd17:4.3.2.pli: Āyasmā mahāmoggallāno iddhipāṭihāriyānusāsaniyā bhikkhū dhammiyā kathāya ovadi anusāsi.
pli-tv-kd17:4.3.2.eng: and Venerable Mahāmoggallāna used the wonder of supernormal powers to the same effect.

pli-tv-kd17:4.3.3.pli: Atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ āyasmatā sāriputtena ādesanāpāṭihāriyānusāsaniyā āyasmatā ca mahāmoggallānena iddhipāṭihāriyānusāsaniyā ovadiyamānānaṃ anusāsiyamānānaṃ virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi—
pli-tv-kd17:4.3.3.eng: While they were being instructed like this, they experienced the stainless vision of the Truth:

pli-tv-kd17:4.3.4.eng: “Anything that has a beginning has an end.”

pli-tv-kd17:4.3.5.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto bhikkhū āmantesi—

pli-tv-kd17:4.3.7.pli: Yo tassa bhagavato dhammaṃ rocesi so āgacchatū”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.3.7.eng: Whoever approves of the teaching of the Buddha should come along.”

pli-tv-kd17:4.3.8.pli: Atha kho sāriputtamoggallānā tāni pañcabhikkhusatāni ādāya yena veḷuvanaṃ tenupasaṅkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd17:4.3.8.eng: Sāriputta and Moggallāna then went to the Bamboo Grove accompanied by those five hundred monks.

pli-tv-kd17:4.3.9.eng: In the meantime Kokālika woke up Devadatta, saying,

pli-tv-kd17:4.3.10.pli: “uṭṭhehi, āvuso devadatta, nītā te bhikkhū sāriputtamoggallānehi.
pli-tv-kd17:4.3.10.eng: “Get up, Devadatta, your monks are being led away by Sāriputta and Moggallāna.

pli-tv-kd17:4.3.11.pli: Nanu tvaṃ, āvuso devadatta, mayā vutto—

pli-tv-kd17:4.3.12.eng: not to trust Sāriputta and Moggallāna?

pli-tv-kd17:4.3.13.pli: Pāpicchā sāriputtamoggallānā, pāpikānaṃ icchānaṃ vasaṃ gatā’”ti?
pli-tv-kd17:4.3.13.eng: Didn’t I say that they have bad desires, that they are in the grip of bad desires?”

pli-tv-kd17:4.3.14.pli: Atha kho devadattassa tattheva uṇhaṃ lohitaṃ mukhato uggañchi.
pli-tv-kd17:4.3.14.eng: And Devadatta vomited hot blood right there.

pli-tv-kd17:4.4.1.pli: Atha kho sāriputtamoggallānā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdisuṃ.
pli-tv-kd17:4.4.1.eng: Sāriputta and Moggallāna then went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd17:4.4.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā sāriputto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd17:4.4.3.eng: “Sir, may we reordain the monks who supported the schism?”

pli-tv-kd17:4.4.5.pli: Mā te rucci bhedakānuvattakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ puna upasampadā.
pli-tv-kd17:4.4.5.eng: don’t think of reordaining the monks who supported the schism.

pli-tv-kd17:4.4.6.pli: Tena hi tvaṃ, sāriputta, bhedakānuvattake bhikkhū thullaccayaṃ desāpehi.
pli-tv-kd17:4.4.6.eng: Instead, have them confess a serious offense.

pli-tv-kd17:4.4.7.pli: Kathaṃ pana te, sāriputta, devadatto paṭipajjī”ti?
pli-tv-kd17:4.4.7.eng: And Devadatta, how did he treat you?”

pli-tv-kd17:4.4.8.pli: “Yatheva, bhante, bhagavā bahudeva rattiṃ bhikkhū dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā maṃ ajjhesati—
pli-tv-kd17:4.4.8.eng: “Just as you, sir, spend most of the night instructing, inspiring, and gladdening the monks with a teaching, and then invite me, saying,

pli-tv-kd17:4.4.9.eng: ‘The Sangha of monks is without dullness and drowsiness.

pli-tv-kd17:4.4.10.pli: paṭibhātu taṃ, sāriputta, bhikkhūnaṃ dhammī kathā, piṭṭhi me āgilāyati, tamahaṃ āyamissāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.4.10.eng: Give a teaching, Sāriputta. My back is aching. I need to stretch it,’

pli-tv-kd17:4.5.1.eng: The Buddha then addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd17:4.5.2.eng: “Once upon a time there was a great lake in a wilderness area

pli-tv-kd17:4.5.4.pli: Te taṃ sarasiṃ ogāhetvā, soṇḍāya bhisamuḷālaṃ abbuhitvā, suvikkhālitaṃ vikkhāletvā, akaddamaṃ saṅkhāditvā ajjhoharanti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.5.4.eng: After plunging into the lake, they pulled up lotus roots and tubers with their trunks. They gave them a good rinse to remove the mud, before chewing and swallowing them.

pli-tv-kd17:4.5.5.pli: Tesaṃ taṃ vaṇṇāya ceva hoti, balāya ca.
pli-tv-kd17:4.5.5.eng: That gave them beauty and strength.

pli-tv-kd17:4.5.6.pli: Na ca tatonidānaṃ maraṇaṃ vā nigacchanti, maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhaṃ.
pli-tv-kd17:4.5.6.eng: And they didn’t die or experience death-like suffering because of that.

pli-tv-kd17:4.5.7.pli: Tesaṃyeva kho pana, bhikkhave, mahānāgānaṃ anusikkhamānā taruṇā bhiṅkacchāpā.
pli-tv-kd17:4.5.7.eng: Then the baby elephants tried to imitate those great elephants.

pli-tv-kd17:4.5.8.pli: Te taṃ sarasiṃ ogāhetvā, soṇḍāya bhisamuḷālaṃ abbuhitvā, na suvikkhālitaṃ vikkhāletvā, sakaddamaṃ saṅkhāditvā, ajjhoharanti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.5.8.eng: After plunging into the lake, they pulled up lotus roots and tubers with their trunks. But they didn’t give them a good rinse to remove the mud, and so they chewed and swallowed them while muddy.

pli-tv-kd17:4.5.9.pli: Tesaṃ taṃ neva vaṇṇāya hoti, na balāya.
pli-tv-kd17:4.5.9.eng: That didn’t give them any beauty or strength.

pli-tv-kd17:4.5.10.pli: Tatonidānañca maraṇaṃ vā nigacchanti, maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhaṃ.
pli-tv-kd17:4.5.10.eng: And they died or experienced death-like suffering because of that.

pli-tv-kd17:4.5.11.pli: Evameva kho, bhikkhave, devadatto mamānukrubbaṃ kapaṇo marissatīti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.5.11.eng: Just so, by imitating me, Devadatta will die miserably.

pli-tv-kd17:4.5.12.eng: ‘While the great being removes the earth,
pli-tv-kd17:4.5.12.comm: Sp 4.346: Mahāvarāhassāti mahānāgassa, “Mahāvarāhassa means the great being/elephant.”

pli-tv-kd17:4.5.13.eng: Eats the tuber, and is alert in the rivers,

pli-tv-kd17:4.5.14.eng: He’s like a baby elephant that’s eaten mud:

pli-tv-kd17:4.5.15.eng: By imitating me, he’ll die miserably.’

pli-tv-kd17:4.6.1.pli: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu dūteyyaṃ gantumarahati.
pli-tv-kd17:4.6.1.eng: “Monks, a monk who has eight qualities is qualified to take messages.

pli-tv-kd17:4.6.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sotā ca hoti, sāvetā ca, uggahetā ca, dhāretā ca, viññātā ca, viññāpetā ca, kusalo ca sahitāsahitassa, no ca kalahakārako—
pli-tv-kd17:4.6.3.eng: He listens and communicates, he learns and remembers, he understands and gets things across, he’s skilled in what is and what isn’t relevant, he’s not argumentative.

pli-tv-kd17:4.6.4.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu dūteyyaṃ gantumarahati.

pli-tv-kd17:4.6.5.pli: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato sāriputto dūteyyaṃ gantumarahati.

pli-tv-kd17:4.6.7.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, sāriputto sotā ca hoti, sāvetā ca, uggahetā ca, dhāretā ca, viññātā ca, viññāpetā ca, kusalo ca sahitāsahitassa, no ca kalahakārako—

pli-tv-kd17:4.6.8.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgato sāriputto dūteyyaṃ gantumarahatīti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.6.8.eng: Because he has these eight qualities, Sāriputta is qualified to take messages.

pli-tv-kd17:4.6.10.eng: With a gathering of fierce debaters.

pli-tv-kd17:4.6.12.eng: Or fail to get the instruction across.

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.1.pli: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, asaddhammehi abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho.
pli-tv-kd17:4.7.1.eng: “It’s because he’s overcome and consumed by eight bad qualities that Devadatta is irredeemably destined to an eon in hell.

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.3.pli: Lābhena, bhikkhave, abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho;

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.6.comm: Sp 2.264: Ayasoti parivāravipatti; parammukhagarahā vā, “Ayaso means lacking an entourage or being disparaged in one’s absence.”

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.10.pli: pāpamittatāya bhikkhave, abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho—

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.11.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahi asaddhammehi abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho.

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.12.pli: Sādhu, bhikkhave, bhikkhu uppannaṃ lābhaṃ abhibhuyya abhibhuyya vihareyya, uppannaṃ alābhaṃ …pe…
pli-tv-kd17:4.7.12.eng: It’s good for a monk to overcome whatever material support he’s affected by, whatever lack of material support he’s affected by,

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.16.eng: whatever lack of honor he’s affected by,

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.17.eng: whatever bad desires he’s affected by,

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.18.eng: and whatever bad friendship he’s affected by.

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.19.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu atthavasaṃ paṭicca uppannaṃ lābhaṃ abhibhuyya abhibhuyya vihareyya, uppannaṃ alābhaṃ …pe…
pli-tv-kd17:4.7.19.eng: For what reason should a monk overcome these things?

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.26.pli: Yaṃ hissa, bhikkhave, uppannaṃ lābhaṃ anabhibhuyya viharato uppajjeyyuṃ āsavā vighātapariḷāhā, uppannaṃ lābhaṃ abhibhuyya abhibhuyya viharato evaṃsate āsavā vighātapariḷāhā na honti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.7.26.eng: If he doesn’t overcome whatever material support he’s affected by, he will experience distressful and feverish corruptions. But if he overcomes whatever material support he’s affected by, he won’t have those distressful and feverish corruptions.

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.27.eng: If he doesn’t overcome whatever lack of material support he’s affected by,

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.31.eng: whatever lack of honor he’s affected by,

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.32.eng: whatever bad desires he’s affected by,

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.33.pli: uppannaṃ pāpamittataṃ anabhibhuyya viharato uppajjeyyuṃ āsavā vighātapariḷāhā, uppannaṃ pāpamittataṃ abhibhuyya abhibhuyya viharato evaṃsate āsavā vighātapariḷāhā na honti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.7.33.eng: or whatever bad friendship he’s affected by, he will experience distressful and feverish corruptions. But if he overcomes whatever bad friendship he’s affected by, he won’t have those distressful and feverish corruptions.

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.34.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, atthavasaṃ paṭicca uppannaṃ lābhaṃ abhibhuyya abhibhuyya vihareyya, uppannaṃ alābhaṃ …pe…
pli-tv-kd17:4.7.34.eng: And so, you should overcome whatever material support you’re affected by, whatever lack of material support you’re affected by,

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.38.eng: whatever lack of honor you’re affected by,

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.39.eng: whatever bad desires you’re affected by,

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.40.eng: and whatever bad friendship you’re affected by.

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.41.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, uppannaṃ lābhaṃ abhibhuyya abhibhuyya viharissāma, uppannaṃ alābhaṃ …pe…

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.48.eng: This is how you should train yourselves.

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.49.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, asaddhammehi abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho.
pli-tv-kd17:4.7.49.eng: And, monks, it’s because he’s overcome and consumed by three bad qualities that Devadatta is irredeemably destined to an eon in hell.

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.51.pli: Pāpicchatā, pāpamittatā, oramattakena visesādhigamena antarā vosānaṃ āpādi—
pli-tv-kd17:4.7.51.eng: Bad desires; bad friendship; and after trifling successes, he has stopped short of the goal.”

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.52.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi asaddhammehi abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekicchoti.

pli-tv-kd17:4.8.2.eng: Is ever reborn in this world.

pli-tv-kd17:4.8.3.eng: In this way you may know

pli-tv-kd17:4.8.4.eng: The destination of those with bad desires.

pli-tv-kd17:4.8.7.eng: It was as if he was shining with fame—

pli-tv-kd17:4.8.8.eng: I have heard Devadatta was like this.

pli-tv-kd17:4.8.11.eng: He’s gone to the Avīci hell,

pli-tv-kd17:4.8.13.eng: If you hurt one free from anger,

pli-tv-kd17:4.8.14.eng: One who doesn’t do anything bad,

pli-tv-kd17:4.8.16.eng: Having a malicious mind and being disrespectful.

pli-tv-kd17:4.8.18.eng: The ocean with a pot of poison,

pli-tv-kd17:4.8.19.eng: But you would not be able to do so,

pli-tv-kd17:4.8.20.eng: For the ocean is frightfully large.
pli-tv-kd17:4.8.20.comm: Bhesmā, literally, “frightening”. The commentary to the parallel verse at Iti 89 says: Bhesmāti vipulabhāvena gambhīrabhāvena ca bhiṁsāpento viya, vipulagambhīroti attho, “‘Frightening’ means large and deep, as in frightening because of its size and depth.”

pli-tv-kd17:4.8.21.eng: It’s the same with the Buddha:

pli-tv-kd17:4.8.22.eng: If by speech one tries to harm him—

pli-tv-kd17:4.8.23.eng: He with right conduct and a peaceful mind—
pli-tv-kd17:4.8.23.comm: Reading sammaggata/sammāgata with the Vipassana Research Institute edition at https://www.tipitaka.org and the PTS edition.

pli-tv-kd17:4.8.25.eng: The wise make friends with such a person,

pli-tv-kd17:4.8.27.eng: The monk who follows his path,

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā upāli yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.1.eng: On one occasion Upāli went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā upāli bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.3.eng: “Sir, we speak of ‘fracture in the Sangha’.

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.4.pli: Kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, saṅgharāji hoti, no ca saṅghabhedo?
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.4.eng: But how is there a fracture in the Sangha, yet not a schism in the Sangha?

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.5.pli: Kittāvatā ca pana saṅgharāji ceva hoti saṅghabhedo cā”ti?
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.5.eng: And how is there both a fracture and a schism in the Sangha?”

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.6.pli: “Ekato, upāli, eko hoti, ekato dve, catuttho anussāveti, salākaṃ gāheti—
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.6.eng: “If, Upāli, there is one monk on one side and two on the other, and a fourth makes the proclamation and distributes ballots, saying,

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.7.pli: ‘ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanaṃ, imaṃ gaṇhatha, imaṃ rocethā’ti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.7.eng: ‘This is the Teaching, this is the Monastic Law, this is the Teacher’s instruction; take this, approve of this,’
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.7.comm: “Take this” refers to the ballots. Sp 4.351: Salākaṁ gāhetīti evaṁ anussāvetvā pana “idaṁ gaṇhatha, idaṁ rocethā”ti vadanto salākaṁ gāheti, “Distributes ballots: having proclaimed this, saying, ‘Take this, approve of this,’ he distributes the ballots.”

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.8.pli: Evampi kho, upāli, saṅgharāji hoti, no ca saṅghabhedo.
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.8.eng: then this is a fracture in the Sangha, but not a schism in the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.9.pli: Ekato, upāli, dve honti, ekato dve, pañcamo anussāveti, salākaṃ gāheti—
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.9.eng: If there are two monks on one side and two on the other, and a fifth makes the proclamation and distributes ballots, saying,

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.10.pli: ‘ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanaṃ, imaṃ gaṇhatha, imaṃ rocethā’ti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.10.eng: ‘This is the Teaching, this is the Monastic Law, this is the Teacher’s instruction; take this, approve of this,’

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.11.pli: Evampi kho, upāli, saṅgharāji hoti, no ca saṅghabhedo.
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.11.eng: then this is a fracture in the Sangha, but not a schism in the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.12.pli: Ekato, upāli, dve honti, ekato tayo, chaṭṭho anussāveti, salākaṃ gāheti—
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.12.eng: If there are two monks on one side and three on the other, and a sixth makes the proclamation and distributes ballots, saying,

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.13.pli: ‘ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanaṃ, imaṃ gaṇhatha, imaṃ rocethā’ti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.13.eng: ‘This is the Teaching, this is the Monastic Law, this is the Teacher’s instruction; take this, approve of this,’

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.14.pli: Evampi kho, upāli, saṅgharāji hoti, no ca saṅghabhedo.
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.14.eng: then this is a fracture in the Sangha, but not a schism in the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.15.pli: Ekato, upāli, tayo honti, ekato tayo, sattamo anussāveti, salākaṃ gāheti—
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.15.eng: If there are three monks on one side and three on the other, and a seventh makes the proclamation and distributes ballots, saying,

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.16.pli: ‘ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanaṃ, imaṃ gaṇhatha, imaṃ rocethā’ti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.16.eng: ‘This is the Teaching, this is the Monastic Law, this is the Teacher’s instruction; take this, approve of this,’

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.17.pli: Evampi kho, upāli, saṅgharāji hoti, no ca saṅghabhedo.
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.17.eng: then this is a fracture in the Sangha, but not a schism in the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.18.pli: Ekato, upāli, tayo honti, ekato cattāro, aṭṭhamo anussāveti, salākaṃ gāheti—
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.18.eng: If there are three monks on one side and four on the other, and an eighth makes the proclamation and distributes ballots, saying,

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.19.pli: ‘ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanaṃ, imaṃ gaṇhatha, imaṃ rocethā’ti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.19.eng: ‘This is the Teaching, this is the Monastic Law, this is the Teacher’s instruction; take this, approve of this,’

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.20.pli: Evampi kho, upāli, saṅgharāji hoti, no ca saṅghabhedo.
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.20.eng: then this is a fracture in the Sangha, but not a schism in the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.21.pli: Ekato, upāli, cattāro honti, ekato cattāro, navamo anussāveti, salākaṃ gāheti—
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.21.eng: But if there are four monks on one side and four on the other, and a ninth makes the proclamation and distributes ballots, saying,

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.22.pli: ‘ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanaṃ, imaṃ gaṇhatha, imaṃ rocethā’ti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.22.eng: ‘This is the Teaching, this is the Monastic Law, this is the Teacher’s instruction; take this, approve of this,’

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.23.pli: Evaṃ kho, upāli, saṅgharāji ceva hoti saṅghabhedo ca.
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.23.eng: then this is both a fracture in the Sangha and also a schism in the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.24.pli: Navannaṃ vā, upāli, atirekanavannaṃ vā saṅgharāji ceva hoti saṅghabhedo ca.
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.24.eng: If there are nine or more monks, then this is both a fracture in the Sangha and also a schism in the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.25.pli: Na kho, upāli, bhikkhunī saṅghaṃ bhindati, api ca bhedāya parakkamati, na sikkhamānā saṅghaṃ bhindati …pe…
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.25.eng: A nun cannot cause a schism in the Sangha, even if she makes an effort to do so. A trainee nun,

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.26.pli: na sāmaṇero saṅghaṃ bhindati, na sāmaṇerī saṅghaṃ bhindati, na upāsako saṅghaṃ bhindati, na upāsikā saṅghaṃ bhindati, api ca bhedāya parakkamati.
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.26.eng: a novice monk, a novice nun, a male lay follower, or a female lay follower cannot cause a schism in the Sangha, even if she makes an effort to do so.

pli-tv-kd17:5.1.27.pli: Bhikkhu kho, upāli, pakatatto, samānasaṃvāsako, samānasīmāyaṃ ṭhito, saṅghaṃ bhindatī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.27.eng: Only a monk of regular standing, one who belongs to the same Buddhist sect and is present within the same monastery zone, can cause a schism in the Sangha.”
pli-tv-kd17:5.1.27.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “monastery zone” for sīmā, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd17:5.2.1.eng: “Sir, we speak of ‘schism in the Sangha’.

pli-tv-kd17:5.2.2.pli: Kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, saṅgho bhinno hotī”ti?
pli-tv-kd17:5.2.2.eng: But how is there a schism in the Sangha?”

pli-tv-kd17:5.2.3.eng: “Take the case when monks proclaim what’s contrary to the Teaching as being in accordance with it.

pli-tv-kd17:5.2.4.eng: They proclaim what’s in accordance with the Teaching as contrary to it.

pli-tv-kd17:5.2.5.eng: They proclaim what’s contrary to the Monastic Law as being in accordance with it.

pli-tv-kd17:5.2.6.eng: They proclaim what’s in accordance with the Monastic Law as contrary to it.

pli-tv-kd17:5.2.7.pli: Abhāsitaṃ alapitaṃ tathāgatena bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpenti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.2.7.eng: They proclaim what hasn’t been spoken by the Buddha as spoken by him.

pli-tv-kd17:5.2.8.pli: Bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ tathāgatena abhāsitaṃ alapitaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpenti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.2.8.eng: They proclaim what’s been spoken by the Buddha as not spoken by him.

pli-tv-kd17:5.2.9.eng: They proclaim what wasn’t practiced by the Buddha as practiced by him.

pli-tv-kd17:5.2.10.eng: They proclaim what was practiced by the Buddha as not practiced by him.

pli-tv-kd17:5.2.11.eng: They proclaim what wasn’t laid down by the Buddha as laid down by him.

pli-tv-kd17:5.2.12.eng: They proclaim what was laid down by the Buddha as not laid down by him.

pli-tv-kd17:5.2.13.eng: They proclaim a non-offense as an offense.

pli-tv-kd17:5.2.14.eng: They proclaim an offense as a non-offense.

pli-tv-kd17:5.2.15.eng: They proclaim a light offense as heavy.

pli-tv-kd17:5.2.16.eng: They proclaim a heavy offense as light.

pli-tv-kd17:5.2.17.eng: They proclaim a curable offense as incurable.

pli-tv-kd17:5.2.18.eng: They proclaim an incurable offense as curable.

pli-tv-kd17:5.2.19.eng: They proclaim a grave offense as minor.

pli-tv-kd17:5.2.20.eng: They proclaim a minor offense as grave.

pli-tv-kd17:5.2.21.pli: Te imehi aṭṭhārasahi vatthūhi apakassanti, avapakassanti, āveniṃ uposathaṃ karonti, āveniṃ pavāraṇaṃ karonti, āveniṃ saṅghakammaṃ karonti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.2.21.eng: If, based on any of these eighteen grounds, they pull away and separate, and they do the observance-day ceremony, the invitation ceremony, or legal procedures of the Sangha separately, then there is a schism in the Sangha.”
pli-tv-kd17:5.2.21.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “invitation ceremony” for pavāraṇā, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd17:5.2.22.pli: Ettāvatā kho, upāli, saṅgho bhinno hotī”ti.

pli-tv-kd17:5.3.1.eng: “Sir, we speak of ‘unity in the Sangha’.

pli-tv-kd17:5.3.2.pli: Kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, saṅgho samaggo hotī”ti?
pli-tv-kd17:5.3.2.eng: But how is there unity in the Sangha?”

pli-tv-kd17:5.3.3.eng: “Take the case when monks proclaim what’s contrary to the Teaching as such.

pli-tv-kd17:5.3.4.eng: They proclaim what’s in accordance with the Teaching as such.

pli-tv-kd17:5.3.5.eng: They proclaim what’s contrary to the Monastic Law as such.

pli-tv-kd17:5.3.6.eng: They proclaim what’s in accordance with the Monastic Law as such.

pli-tv-kd17:5.3.7.pli: Abhāsitaṃ alapitaṃ tathāgatena abhāsitaṃ alapitaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpenti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.3.7.eng: They proclaim what hasn’t been spoken by the Buddha as such.

pli-tv-kd17:5.3.8.pli: Bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ tathāgatena bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpenti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.3.8.eng: They proclaim what’s been spoken by the Buddha as such.

pli-tv-kd17:5.3.9.eng: They proclaim what wasn’t practiced by the Buddha as such.

pli-tv-kd17:5.3.10.eng: They proclaim what was practiced by the Buddha as such.

pli-tv-kd17:5.3.11.eng: They proclaim what wasn’t laid down by the Buddha as such.

pli-tv-kd17:5.3.12.eng: They proclaim what was laid down by the Buddha as such.

pli-tv-kd17:5.3.13.eng: They proclaim a non-offense as such.

pli-tv-kd17:5.3.14.eng: They proclaim an offense as such.

pli-tv-kd17:5.3.15.eng: They proclaim a light offense as light.

pli-tv-kd17:5.3.16.eng: They proclaim a heavy offense as heavy.

pli-tv-kd17:5.3.17.eng: They proclaim a curable offense as curable.

pli-tv-kd17:5.3.18.eng: They proclaim an incurable offense as incurable.

pli-tv-kd17:5.3.19.eng: They proclaim a grave offense as grave.

pli-tv-kd17:5.3.20.eng: They proclaim a minor offense as minor.

pli-tv-kd17:5.3.21.pli: Te imehi aṭṭhārasahi vatthūhi na apakassanti, na avapakassanti, na āveniṃ uposathaṃ karonti, na āveniṃ pavāraṇaṃ karonti, na āveniṃ saṅghakammaṃ karonti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.3.21.eng: If, based on any of these eighteen grounds, they don’t pull away or separate, and they don’t do the observance-day ceremony, the invitation ceremony, or legal procedures of the Sangha separately,

pli-tv-kd17:5.3.22.pli: Ettāvatā kho, upāli, saṅgho samaggo hotī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.3.22.eng: then there is unity in the Sangha.”

pli-tv-kd17:5.4.1.pli: “Samaggaṃ pana, bhante, saṅghaṃ bhinditvā kiṃ so pasavatī”ti?
pli-tv-kd17:5.4.1.eng: “But, sir, what’s the consequence of causing a schism in a united Sangha?”
pli-tv-kd17:5.4.1.comm: Partial parallels to AN 10.39:0.3 and Iti 18.

pli-tv-kd17:5.4.2.pli: “Samaggaṃ kho, upāli, saṅghaṃ bhinditvā kappaṭṭhikaṃ kibbisaṃ pasavati, kappaṃ nirayamhi paccatīti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.4.2.eng: “Anyone who causes a schism in a united Sangha does an evil act with effect for an eon. He’s boiled in hell for an eon.”

pli-tv-kd17:5.4.4.eng: The schismatic stays there for an eon.

pli-tv-kd17:5.4.8.eng: He boils in hell for an eon.”

pli-tv-kd17:5.4.9.pli: “Bhinnaṃ pana, bhante, saṅghaṃ samaggaṃ katvā kiṃ so pasavatī”ti?
pli-tv-kd17:5.4.9.eng: “But, sir, what’s the consequence of uniting a schismatic sangha?”
pli-tv-kd17:5.4.9.comm: Partial parallels to AN 10.40:0.3 and Iti 19.

pli-tv-kd17:5.4.10.pli: “Bhinnaṃ kho, upāli, saṅghaṃ samaggaṃ katvā brahmaṃ puññaṃ pasavati, kappaṃ saggamhi modatīti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.4.10.eng: “Anyone who unites a schismatic sangha generates supreme merit. He rejoices in heaven for an eon.”

pli-tv-kd17:5.4.12.eng: And to help the fostering of harmony.
pli-tv-kd17:5.4.12.comm: Samaggānañca anuggaho, literally, “and the helping of those who are united”. The commentary to the parallel verse at Iti 19:3.2 says: Samaggānañcanuggahoti samaggānaṁ sāmaggianumodanena anuggaṇhanaṁ sāmaggianurūpaṁ, yathā te sāmaggiṁ na vijahanti, tathā gahaṇaṁ ṭhapanaṁ anubalappadānanti attho, “Samaggānañcanuggaho means: one who rejoices in unity helps those who are united in accordance with what is suitable for unity; he takes hold of it, firms it up, and supports it, so that they do not abandon that unity.”

pli-tv-kd17:5.4.16.eng: He rejoices in heaven for an eon.”

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.1.pli: “Siyā nu kho, bhante, saṅghabhedako āpāyiko, nerayiko, kappaṭṭho, atekiccho”ti?
pli-tv-kd17:5.5.1.eng: “Might one who causes a schism in the Sangha be irredeemably destined to an eon in hell?”

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.2.pli: “Siyā, upāli, saṅghabhedako āpāyiko, nerayiko, kappaṭṭho, atekiccho”ti.

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.3.pli: “Siyā pana, bhante, saṅghabhedako na āpāyiko, na nerayiko, na kappaṭṭho, na atekiccho”ti?
pli-tv-kd17:5.5.3.eng: “Might one who causes a schism in the Sangha not be irredeemably destined to an eon in hell?”

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.4.pli: “Siyā, upāli, saṅghabhedako na āpāyiko, na nerayiko, na kappaṭṭho, na atekiccho”ti.

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.5.1.pli: “Katamo pana, bhante, saṅghabhedako āpāyiko, nerayiko, kappaṭṭho, atekiccho”ti?
pli-tv-kd17:5.5.5.1.eng: “What sort of person who causes a schism in the Sangha is irredeemably destined to an eon in hell?”

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.6.eng: “In this case a monk proclaims what’s contrary to the Teaching as being in accordance with it.

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.7.pli: Tasmiṃ adhammadiṭṭhi, bhede adhammadiṭṭhi, vinidhāya diṭṭhiṃ, vinidhāya khantiṃ, vinidhāya ruciṃ, vinidhāya bhāvaṃ, anussāveti, salākaṃ gāheti—
pli-tv-kd17:5.5.7.eng: He has the view that what he says is illegitimate and the view that the schism is illegitimate. He misrepresents his view of what’s true, his belief of what’s true, his acceptance of what’s true, or his sentiment of what’s true. He makes a proclamation and distributes ballots, saying,

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.8.pli: ‘ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanaṃ, imaṃ gaṇhatha, imaṃ rocethā’ti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.5.8.eng: ‘This is the Teaching, this is the Monastic Law, this is the Teacher’s instruction; take this, approve of this.’

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.9.pli: Ayampi kho, upāli, saṅghabhedako āpāyiko, nerayiko, kappaṭṭho, atekiccho.
pli-tv-kd17:5.5.9.eng: When such a person causes a schism in the Sangha, he’s irredeemably destined to an eon in hell.

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.10.pli: Puna caparaṃ, upāli, bhikkhu adhammaṃ dhammoti dīpeti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.5.10.eng: Again, a monk proclaims what’s contrary to the Teaching as being in accordance with it.

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.11.pli: Tasmiṃ adhammadiṭṭhi, bhede dhammadiṭṭhi, vinidhāya diṭṭhiṃ, vinidhāya khantiṃ, vinidhāya ruciṃ, vinidhāya bhāvaṃ, anussāveti, salākaṃ gāheti—
pli-tv-kd17:5.5.11.eng: He has the view that what he says is illegitimate, but the view that the schism is legitimate. He misrepresents his view of what’s true, his belief of what’s true, his acceptance of what’s true, or his sentiment of what’s true. He makes a proclamation and distributes ballots, saying,

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.12.pli: ‘ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanaṃ, imaṃ gaṇhatha, imaṃ rocethā’ti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.5.12.eng: ‘This is the Teaching, this is the Monastic Law, this is the Teacher’s instruction; take this, approve of this.’

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.13.pli: Ayampi kho, upāli, saṅghabhedako āpāyiko, nerayiko, kappaṭṭho, atekiccho.
pli-tv-kd17:5.5.13.eng: When such a person causes a schism in the Sangha, he too is irredeemably destined to an eon in hell.

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.14.pli: Puna caparaṃ, upāli, bhikkhu adhammaṃ dhammoti dīpeti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.5.14.eng: Again, a monk proclaims what’s contrary to the Teaching as being in accordance with it.

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.15.pli: Tasmiṃ adhammadiṭṭhi, bhede vematiko, vinidhāya diṭṭhiṃ, vinidhāya khantiṃ, vinidhāya ruciṃ, vinidhāya bhāvaṃ, anussāveti, salākaṃ gāheti—
pli-tv-kd17:5.5.15.eng: He has the view that what he says is illegitimate, but is unsure about the schism. He misrepresents his view of what’s true, his belief of what’s true, his acceptance of what’s true, or his sentiment of what’s true. He makes a proclamation and distributes ballots, saying,

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.16.pli: ‘ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanaṃ, imaṃ gaṇhatha, imaṃ rocethā’ti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.5.16.eng: ‘This is the Teaching, this is the Monastic Law, this is the Teacher’s instruction; take this, approve of this.’

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.17.pli: Ayampi kho, upāli, saṅghabhedako āpāyiko, nerayiko, kappaṭṭho, atekiccho.
pli-tv-kd17:5.5.17.eng: When such a person causes a schism in the Sangha, he too is irredeemably destined to an eon in hell.

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.18.pli: Puna caparaṃ, upāli, bhikkhu adhammaṃ dhammoti dīpeti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.5.18.eng: Again, a monk proclaims what’s contrary to the Teaching as being in accordance with it.

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.19.eng: He has the view that what he says is legitimate, but the view that the schism is illegitimate …

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.20.comm: This is only found in MS, and is missing in the PTS edition. It could be rendered as follows: “He has the view that what he says is legitimate and the view that the schism is legitimate.” This seems to be a mistake in MS, since the whole point of this is that the monk “misrepresents his view of what’s true, his belief of what’s true, his acceptance of what’s true, or his sentiment of what’s true”. This assessment is supported by the fact that the parallel passage at Pvr 19:80.1 does not have this combination. See Sp 5.477, which gives the details on this passage, which is only contracted in the Canonical text.

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.21.eng: He has the view that what he says is legitimate, but is unsure about the schism …

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.22.eng: He is unsure about what he says, but has the view that the schism is illegitimate …

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.23.eng: He is unsure about what he says, but has the view that the schism is legitimate …

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.24.pli: Tasmiṃ vematiko bhede vematiko vinidhāya diṭṭhiṃ, vinidhāya khantiṃ, vinidhāya ruciṃ, vinidhāya bhāvaṃ, anussāveti, salākaṃ gāheti—
pli-tv-kd17:5.5.24.eng: He is unsure about what he says and is unsure about the schism. He misrepresents his view of what’s true, his belief of what’s true, his acceptance of what’s true, or his sentiment of what’s true. He makes a proclamation and distributes ballots, saying,

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.25.pli: ‘ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanaṃ, imaṃ gaṇhatha, imaṃ rocethā’ti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.5.25.eng: ‘This is the Teaching, this is the Monastic Law, this is the Teacher’s instruction; take this, approve of this.’

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.26.pli: Ayampi kho, upāli, saṅghabhedako āpāyiko, nerayiko, kappaṭṭho, atekiccho.
pli-tv-kd17:5.5.26.eng: When such a person causes a schism in the Sangha, he too is irredeemably destined to an eon in hell.

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.27.eng: Again, a monk proclaims what’s in accordance with the Teaching as contrary to it,

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.28.eng: what’s contrary to the Monastic Law as being in accordance with it,

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.29.eng: what’s in accordance with the Monastic Law as contrary to it,

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.30.pli: abhāsitaṃ alapitaṃ tathāgatena bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpeti …
pli-tv-kd17:5.5.30.eng: what hasn’t been spoken by the Buddha as spoken by him,

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.31.pli: bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ tathāgatena abhāsitaṃ alapitaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpeti …
pli-tv-kd17:5.5.31.eng: what’s been spoken by the Buddha as not spoken by him,

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.32.eng: what wasn’t practiced by the Buddha as practiced by him,

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.33.eng: what was practiced by the Buddha as not practiced by him,

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.35.eng: what was laid down by the Buddha as not laid down by him,

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.47.eng: He has the view that what he says is legitimate, but the view that the schism is illegitimate. …

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.49.eng: He has the view that what he says is legitimate, but is unsure about the schism. …

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.52.pli: tasmiṃ vematiko, bhede vematiko, vinidhāya diṭṭhiṃ, vinidhāya khantiṃ, vinidhāya ruciṃ, vinidhāya bhāvaṃ, anussāveti, salākaṃ gāheti—
pli-tv-kd17:5.5.52.eng: He is unsure about what he says and unsure about the schism. He misrepresents his view of what’s true, his belief of what’s true, his acceptance of what’s true, or his sentiment of what’s true. He makes a proclamation and distributes ballots, saying,

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.53.pli: ‘ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanaṃ, imaṃ gaṇhatha, imaṃ rocethā’ti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.5.53.eng: ‘This is the Teaching, this is the Monastic Law, this is the Teacher’s instruction; take this, approve of this.’

pli-tv-kd17:5.5.54.pli: Ayampi kho, upāli, saṅghabhedako āpāyiko, nerayiko, kappaṭṭho, atekiccho”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.5.54.eng: When such a person causes a schism in the Sangha, he too is irredeemably destined to an eon in hell.”

pli-tv-kd17:5.6.1.pli: “Katamo pana, bhante, saṅghabhedako na āpāyiko, na nerayiko, na kappaṭṭho, na atekiccho”ti?
pli-tv-kd17:5.6.1.eng: “What sort of person who causes a schism in the Sangha isn’t irredeemably destined to an eon in hell?”

pli-tv-kd17:5.6.2.eng: “In this case a monk proclaims what’s contrary to the Teaching as being in accordance with it.

pli-tv-kd17:5.6.3.pli: Tasmiṃ dhammadiṭṭhi, bhede dhammadiṭṭhi, avinidhāya diṭṭhiṃ, avinidhāya khantiṃ, avinidhāya ruciṃ, avinidhāya bhāvaṃ, anussāveti, salākaṃ gāheti—
pli-tv-kd17:5.6.3.eng: He has the view that what he says is legitimate and the view that the schism is legitimate. He doesn’t misrepresent his view of what’s true, his belief of what’s true, his acceptance of what’s true, or his sentiment of what’s true. He makes a proclamation and distributes ballots, saying,

pli-tv-kd17:5.6.4.pli: ‘ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanaṃ, imaṃ gaṇhatha, imaṃ rocethā’ti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.6.4.eng: ‘This is the Teaching, this is the Monastic Law, this is the Teacher’s instruction; take this, approve of this.’

pli-tv-kd17:5.6.5.pli: Ayampi kho, upāli, saṅghabhedako na āpāyiko, na nerayiko, na kappaṭṭho, na atekiccho.
pli-tv-kd17:5.6.5.eng: When such a person causes a schism in the Sangha, he’s not irredeemably destined to an eon in hell.

pli-tv-kd17:5.6.6.pli: Puna caparaṃ, upāli, bhikkhu dhammaṃ adhammoti dīpeti …pe…
pli-tv-kd17:5.6.6.eng: Again, a monk proclaims what’s in accordance with the Teaching as contrary to it …

pli-tv-kd17:5.6.7.eng: or a minor offense as grave.

pli-tv-kd17:5.6.9.eng: ‘This is the Teaching, this is the Monastic Law, this is the Teacher’s instruction; take this, approve of this.’

pli-tv-kd17:5.6.10.pli: Ayampi kho, upāli, saṅghabhedako na āpāyiko, na nerayiko, na kappaṭṭho, na atekiccho”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:5.6.10.eng: When such a person causes a schism in the Sangha, he too isn’t irredeemably destined to an eon in hell.”
